    2014-02-05: This is a great case to protect your Nexus, and can't be beat for the price.The design is well planned and thought out. There are four clips that hold the phone firmly in place, located on each corner. There is plenty of room to access the buttons and charging port.The exterior is "Synthetic PU Leather", which feels like soft glove leather. Some people might prefer genuine leather, but you can't even tell the difference. The interior is microfiber, which fell like suede. The softness of the microfiber will protect the back and screen.Once your phone is placed inside the case, it is safely protected by the cover, which clips to the right side of the phone. On the back, the camera and flash cut out is just the right size. The case can also be used in landscape mode to view movies. This is done by adding a groove into the cover, which holds the phone at the perfect viewing angle.CONTENTS:EassyAcc Nexus 5 Leather Flip CaseFEATURES:Exterior: Synthetic PU LeatherInterior: MicrofiberI was supplied a sample for the purpose of review.

    2014-07-03: This is the first case I've owned that I don't hate. Phone designers spend time and effort making their products beautiful and sleek, then we slap cases the size of a phone book on them. I never understood that. This case comes straight from Google, and it looks like it. Honestly, upon quick glance, it doesn't even look like the phone has a case. It looks like a part of the phone, beautiful and simple. It fits securely and works with my screen protector. All of the ports are still perfectly accessible. Qi wireless charging works just fine. And it really doesn't add too much bulk, I actually kind of like the substantial but not over-the-top feel it provides. And the finish is the same as the Nexus 5 itself - it's that velvety, matte black plastic. I'm not sure how much protection it will provide, but it has to be better than nothing. Minus one star because the buttons are indeed hard to push, but I can get over that. Overall, it's worth the extra money!

This showed me that if it weren't for it the iphone screen would have been cracked in those spots. So it saved the screen but I did have to use another Membrane out of the pack to have a clear screen again, which is definitely better than a new screen.

    Rating: 2

    2014-07-06: Most folks get frustrated with inexpensive screen protectors like these. Toward the end of this review I have a tip that my be useful. What you like in screen protector will depend on your preference, so I wrote about my experience.The protector itself offers a clean image without a matte and/or darkened finish, and for me, does not interfere with the touch-screen interface. The anti-glare aspect gives it a glistening or crystalized effect at times, but not to where it blocks visibility. Oil and residue tend to show fairly easily, but it also wipes off easily. The fit around home button, camera, etc is about 95% accurate, but this usually the case with generic protectors. Applying them can be frustrating, but I don't necessarily think it is a product defect, just the nature of living in a world with dust.Tip: I have a method that works for me, but not claiming that it trumps others. First, make sure fans, a/c, etc are all off. When wiping the bare screen before application, I do it slowly b/c I've noticed rapid or intense wiping builds up static electricity. After that I get a handheld vacuum and place it near the phone. When I'm ready to apply the protector, I turn the vacuum on and keep it running until I am satisfied the protector placement. I still get a bubble or two, but they are usually unobtrusive and away from the screen.

    Rating: 4

    2013-01-03: I received this pack of Membrane protectors for my iPhone, and I can say that I am satisfied! It was very easy to install and whats great about this is that this pack comes with extra protectors just in case you happen to make a mistake. Easy to use, easy to install, no fingerprints and no smudges. I would buy again!

    Rating: 4

    2013-01-26: It took several tries at lining the protector up just right to get it situated on the back of the iPhone so it fits.     Rating: 5

    2014-05-14: Matte screen protectors aren't for everyone. At times I find myself missing the sleek glossy look of a standard screen protector. However, Matte screens have their advantages. They don't fingerprint nearly as easily, nor do they reflect the sun as much. The result is a screen that doesn't have to be wiped as often and that doesn't cause as much strain on your eyes in sunny conditions. As far as this particular screen saver goes it's acceptable. The screen protector fit my iPhone 4s very well. Application was fairly easy, although not fool-proof. I have yet to find a screen protector that doesn't bubble. Overall, it's a pretty standard matte screen protector that I was satisfied with.

    Rating: 4

    2014-04-26: Nice, thick, membrane and I have been using it for a couple of weeks. I like it. But, it is difficult to put on the phone without leaving bubbles. I have two, very annoying, bubbles which I was unable to eliminate. For those more dextrous than I it is probably a snap.

    Rating: 4

    2013-01-30: I rarely give 5 stars to a product but at this price point there's not much to complain about. Yes, there's certainly cheaper product but you get what you pay for and what ends up happening later is either frustration of the product failing to protect your screen (it is, after all, what you bought it for right?) or that it's yet another piece of pvc film that attracts scratches like fleas to a dog. The Aduro screen certainly isn't scratchproof but it's thick and durable. What I liked most was that they supplied you with 3 screen protectors, a chamois for cleaning the screen prior to adhesion and well marked tabs. Precision wasn't my forte so and of course if you're in a dusty environment no matter how quick at the draw you are after cleaning the screen there's a decent chance something tiny will land on the screen in between time when you remove the protector and apply the film. For this, keep some scotch tape handy for the clean up job. Use a piece to slowly remove the film and another piece of tape to peel the little bugger off.I'll be upgrading my iPhone soon and have bookmarked this product as I'll be doing this exercise all over again.

    Rating: 5

    2013-08-28: - Meticulous installation required (99.99% of you can do this!)- Provides tough protection (Phone and keys carried in same pocket)- It appears to retain "smudges" which are only seen when off (Insignificant / greasy fingers)- "Feels good being protected"

    Rating: 4

    2013-03-29: Simply stated, this is the best screen protector I have ever used and I have used protectors costing upwards of $15 each. I loved these screen protectors so much, I just bought 3 more packages to stock up. Anyone familiar with applying a screen protector understands the agony that can often be associated with such an effort. Typically, you are trying to avoid bubbles under the screen. Another problem is that some protectors are too stiff while others are not stiff enough. This results in misalignment when applying or even more bubbles. Also, some screen protectors cannot be easily adjusted during the application process. The Arduro protectors remarkably resolve all these issues.The Arduro Membrane protectors apply very easily. They are just stiff enough that during application bubbles are easily avoided from the onset. If air bubbles do result, they aare easily worked out. Screen protectors not stiff enough tend to have more issues with air bubbles. During application, the screen protector can easily be removed and readjusted if you misaligned during application. However, once done, the screen protector is incredibly secure with no "edge liftoff" often associated with other types. The adhesive is truly remarkable.The screen protectors were a perfect fit and crystal clear; very high quality. And like Arduro says, they are trylu ultra clear except for any smudges that may result from your thumb during use. These are easily wiped off.Seriously, don't spend more when you do not have to. These protectors are great. Just understand that these protectors are not the matte type and some reflection, especially outdoors, will happen.

    Rating: 5

    2013-10-15: This thing once it's on looks beautiful but I have to admit that it took two tries before I could get this item on, not because of the bubbles but because of the number tabs, you need to use to unpeeled and need to handle to put it on your phone, came apart. I think it was a manufacture defect that I got but I was able to get the second one to come off clean after carefully taking it apart without touching the center or the sides. I would recommend the Moshi one instead but this one is just as great but be careful with the tabs they might peel of sooner than you need them to.

    2014-01-30: My last el-cheapo screen protector started separating after many years of faithful service, so I decided it was time for something new. This was fairly easy to put on. I was actually able to remove it and adjust my placement without completely ruining the edges or adhesive. It adheres well to my phone around the home button and earpiece/camera - a problem that I've had with the much more expensive Zagg screen protectors. Aside from a few tiny bubbles (my own fault for not cleaning the screen well enough) you can hardly tell it's there. The included sheet for the back of the phone might not be necessary if you have a case, but my case has a tendency to collect dust and dirt from my pocket which has already scratched the back of my phone, so I decided it was best to use it anyway. Just make sure you THOROUGHLY clean the front and back before you put this on. Spend more time on this than you think you need to because every speck of dust will cause a bubble.

    Rating: 5

    2012-11-22: I got this three-pack together with theAduro Shell Holster Combo Case for Apple iPhone 5 with Kick-Stand & Belt Clip (At&t;, Verizon, T-Mobile & Sprint)and it seems ok in my inexpert opinion. It is however a pain to apply as it can't be lined up with the edge of the iPhone - it's about a millimeter smaller all around. I'm not really sure why this is as the Aduro's own shell doesn't cover the outer edge of the screen or anything? Anyway it makes it tricky to apply the protector perfectly, and I wound up with a slight overlap at the front receiver opening. It's not terribly difficult to reset the protector but there's only so much time I want to spend fiddling with it!!! It's AMAZINGLY easy to trap dust and lint under the protector...As far as clarity goes, the (matte) protector cuts down on glare but makes the iPhone's graphics very slightly cloudy - though not enough to interfere with visibility. It does pick up fingerprints, but I feel more comfortable wiping them off the protector than the actual screen... Anyway I guess I can't complain too much for the price.

    2012-12-01: I recently got my first iPhone after using Android phones for several years and I wanted something to protect the screen from scratches, etc. I depend on reviews to make purchases like these so I ordered these (after trying another brand that was horrible, those were promptly sent back).     Rating: 5

    2012-10-11: Like all screen protectors the installation is not the easiest when it comes to avoiding even a tiny bit of dust. I installed two of these and the secret seems to be peeling the back just a little and starting the application from the top of the phone and peeling back slowly while sticking the cover on. This cover seems to be cut just right so that it fits and lines up when your phone is in a silicone case because the edges of the case do not make this peel at all.The only issue I have is with the bottom of this cover just below the home button. On both covers the very bottom does not adhere well at all. It's only been a couple of weeks and already there is dust from my pocket that is starting to collect in this area. I even carry the phone upside down in my pocket so that the bottom is upwards, in order to limit the amount of dust that will no doubt build up.

  • B004F98U8Q

    $B004F98U8Q

    2011-10-31: I have a bluetooth headset but I was looking for a wired headset for my iPhone.I ran across this and the price and reviews made it tough to resist.I'm not crazy about the fit - as you can see from the pics, it actually attaches underneath the ear instead of over it. While that works fine, it just feels a little weird and loose, even though it's not.The sound is fantastic. The voices you hear are loud and clear, and people tell me that headset sounds good on their end.The only real drawback is portability.There's an inline switchbox with controls for volume, mute and a button for call answer/end. It would be nice if these controls could be on the headset itself instead of inline on the wire. The added bulk makes it difficult to just wrap this headset up and stuff it in your pocket. In jacket weather this shouldn't be a problem. But if you're not wearing a jacket, carrying this around is a little cumbersome. I keep it in my laptop bag but if I don't have that with me there's just not a good way to bring this headset with you.That aside, this is a terrific headset with great sound, no bluetooth-is-scrambling-my-brain worries, and a great price.

    Rating: 4

    2012-01-30: I can barely hear the in-call volume on my HTC Android. The dial tone and key sounds come through fine. I returned the first set thinking it was defective and the second had the same problem. I have two older Plantronics headsets that work just fine so I guess I'll go back to using those.

    Rating: 1

    2014-02-09: When it works, I like everything about the design of the headset, the boom, the sound, and the comfort of it on my ear.BUT I've owned four of these. Each one of them developed a short in the control housing (the part that contains the volume knob, the mute switch, and the Call/Answer button). The first two I purchased because I didn't know these would have this kind of problem. The third and fourth I bought because I like the headset so much I figured these are so inexpensive I can just buy a new one when it shorts. BUT, that's wearing on me now. I don't think I will buy these again.

    Rating: 2

    2011-08-13: Ok, so who on earth would want a corded headset for their phone these days? Well, someone who uses Skype on their iPhone that is who! I bought an awesome Plantronics blutooth headset only to find that if you are using Skype for iphone it does not work! Works great on the iphone if you are using the regular phone though. For skype at my desktop I use the similar boom type plantronics model but because it has a 2.5mm plug I need to use and adapter and when I tried that with 2 different adapters and the earphone sound comes through but the mic does not (tried 2 different adapters!) so you can hear fine but the people on the other end can hear you only through the mic on your phone. In a horribly embarrassing moment I learned that muting the mic did not mean all of my coworkers on the other end of a conference call could not hear me yelling at my dog LOL!Anyway- forsome reason all of 3.5mm headsets that they are still making have the mic on the cord and because I tend to talk while I am doing other things people hear my hair or clothes or whatever brushing up agains the mic so FINALLY found one that had a boom mic AND a 3.5mm jack so I would not need an adapter! Wooohoo! Liberated from my desktop during phone calls finally!Since I used the desktop version of this mic I was already used to the earpiece. I won't lie- it took awhile. It is not uncomfortable in terms of fit (bluetooth one was) but it feels wierd and like it will fall out at any moment. After using it for sometime I have gotten comfortable that it will say in and when I am sitting at my desk I will often find I left it in my ear after ending the call ages ago!Bluetooth can be a great solution but it has its drawbacks (battery, connection quality etc) so I am baffled as to why everyone is leaving the wired ones behind. This is goofy looking for sure but I am not one to walk around the grocery store with this or any other headset on. When I am home or in my car and want to be hands free with a good connection I like a wired solution! If Skype for iphone had worked with bluetooth I would have settled for it since I had already bought it but until it does smartphone users who rely on voip will need this!The annoying thing is that there are lots of headsets out there that say 'works with iphone' and in reality they are 2.5mm plug heasets that come with an adapte. The MX505 also comes in a 2.5mm plug version and inexplicably has the same model number so I had little confidence that I could pick the right listing on amazon and get the right headset from the 3rd party sellers so I bought mine on ebay where the seller confirmed he would send the 3.5mm version so pay attention when you buy!

    Rating: 5

    2012-05-14: 'Nuff said. I returned it. I prefer wired headsets. I've never been a fan of Bluetooth. I'm still looking for one to replace the *perfect* one I had that died out after 5 years.

    Rating: 1

    2011-10-30: I was looking for a 3.5mm replacement for my old Plantronics 2.5mm wired headset since I had just switched to a 3.5mm Android phone. I found this wired 3.5mm Plantronics MX505 WindSmart Boom Headset and love it. It is very light weight, sits securely on my ear and can be worn for long periods of time. This particular headset secures gently underneath the ear which I really like because over-the-ear headsets make my ears ache. I have unusually small ears so every Bluetooth I've tried won't sit properly and just falls right off. I've had a lot of success with the wired Plantronics headsets in the past and this one is just as good as my previous sets. The sound is crystal clear with no noise or echoing. This set does come with a replacement boom.NOTE: I did buy the 2.5mm to 3.5mm converter when I purchased this headset but found I did not need it as the jack is 3.5mm. It is not clear from the description that this is the case.

    2012-06-15: Ordered from 11th Street Wireless and received 3 days later. I cannot distinguish between the earphones that I received and the original OEM Apple set that came with my iPhone 3GS. They have the same exact appearance, control button functionality and sound reproduction from both earphones and microphone. Perhaps these are from an Apple OEM supplier but bypassing the Apple sales channel? I say this to distinguish this set from another set that I received directly from Hong Kong from another seller (for about a couple bucks) and that looked almost like OEM. That set, however, had completely unacceptable earphone sound quality - trash bin unacceptable. The lesson here is to be careful from whom you buy.

    2013-12-17: Really love how you can talk on the phone while listening to music and never have to take the earphones out. The volume control is a really cool feature.

    Rating: 5

    2012-04-17: I should start off by stating my seller was iMobile Texas. I received these (I ordered 2 pairs) within about 3 days of my order which was the first day of the delivery estimate window, didn't have to wait too long at all.Immediately upon receipt I noticed I did not receive the black "heavy duty canvas pouch" - but I didn't want it anyway.As for the earphones themselves...they were "packaged" like an OEM Apple product but once you get your hands on them they don't feel like an OEM Apple product. The wires are thinner and more flexible and just feel cheaper. The area where the wires come out both sides of the button weren't reinforced like Apple's are. The button was bowed out in the center which makes the button's construction look very cheap and like it wouldn't be long before it falls apart. The worst problem of all was that neither pair worked properly, at least on iPhone 4S. They sound and feel normal when you plug them in but once you get on the phone the person on the other end hears only a very loud humming tone and it's too loud to even hear me. I gave the other pair of earphones to the other person and I had the same problem with those as well. All the reviews on these things were great so maybe it was just the ones from this particular seller that are having issues.In short, all these things are good for is listening to music, but if I just wanted to do that I would have purchased a better set of actual headphones, without worrying about getting a microphone on them. I'm not comfortable calling these "OEM" as described in the product's TITLE.When confronting the seller with the problem they were very very quick to respond and resolve the issue 100% to my satisfaction. Part of their response was that they "had some issues with one of their suppliers and were working with them to resolve the issue." This raised some flags for me because they made it sounds like these earphones are just cheap imitations like so many others you see on the web, but they are supposed to be OEM products. So even though my issues are resolved and were resolved quickly, that still doesn't change the fact that they listed these as "OEM" when they probably were not...so I have to warn future buyers.

    2013-07-25: Like so many others, I wondered if these were in fact OEM. After receiving mine, I inspected them closely and tried them out. Everything seems to indicate that these are OEM. About the only difference I saw was in the packaging and also the color or the in-line remote. These came in a plastic bag with a sticker on it. Of course the OEM Apple product came inside the box with a simple clear plastic wrap around it. The second difference was the color of the inside part of the remote. These were just white whereas the OEM ones I had were a light grey. I've uploaded a picture so people can compare. With regards to the function and the look and feel, they are exactly like the OEM units. So perhaps these are not from Apple, but they appear to be made by the same folks who are making them for Apple, which seems close enough. Bottom line is that for the price, it's a great deal.

    Rating: 5

    2012-12-10: I love how the fitment was for the mold, not too tight, but not so loose that it would just slip out of the edges through handling. It does double the tablet's thickness (maybe 2.5x times the thickness), but it's ok since holding a bare tablet can cramp up your hands, so having a thicker tablet to hold on to will relieve some of the stress. The texture is great, only if it's remains clean and free from dust, clean it often so that the exterior doesnt become too slick. A wet sponge (you can take off the cover from the tablet of course) will keep the surface from collecting too much dust and particles. I treat it like a table tennis rubber paddle (see care for ping pong paddles) to make it last and feel tacky for years of non-slip use. All the cut-outs line up and I would recommend this to anyone that uses their tablet a lot. I would also mention that this tablet is too thick to be placed into a docking station. So be mindful of that. I'm not a guy that love accessories, but this one is a must-have. The thickness is good enough that you can put this face-down on a table and it will keep the screen from being scratched up, so you dont need a screen protector shield (I'm not a fan of them). If anything, I'm a purist when it comes to keeping the tablet as raw as possible, so if I need to sell it, it will feel as if it came out of the box unused. This is one of the best cases to use. Easy to clean (since you can just take it off and just hand-wash in the sink and let it air-dry). The black doesnt stay black if you carry it around and you have a dusty environment it's a magnet for dust, I would get a different color.

    Rating: 4
