    2013-10-23: I like covers that are as unobtrusive as possible both in design and feel, and for the price, in my opinion this is the best cover available for the Galaxy S4. The fit is superb, and all the buttons retain nice feedback (albeit ever so slightly mushy for those sensitive enough to tell). It is not bulky at all, which has led some to question how protective it is. The short answer is that it's protective enough for me. If you drop your phone a lot, perhaps an Otterbox is a better choice.Some complain of the back of this case being slippery, but I didn't find that to be a problem. The sides are a TPU-like soft yet firm silicone, while the back is a hard, glossy plastic that mimics the back of the Note 2 (I say the Note 2 because I find that back to be more slippery than the S4). Because the sides of this case have grip, I never felt my S4 was in danger of slipping out of my hand.Due to the nature of having a hard plastic back, this cover does scratch over time. The white fares a little better than the darker blue (which I had on my Note 2), but both scratch.

  • B00ITI6L1M

    $B00ITI6L1M

    2014-06-23: Cables, cables everywhere. What drives me bonkers is the mess of cables I find in my car because everyone in my family has different generation iPhones or iPods. I can't leave out the speakerphone and GPS that uses a different USB cable as well.The Wecharger has put a stop of having for all those cables. Now my son can charge his iPod Touch 4G and hubby his iPhone 4S with the 30 pin adapter. My daughter and I can use the 8-pin for our iPhone 5S we each have and the micro USB comes in handy to charge my GPS, digital camera and speakerphone. I can't leave out the iPads which we have different generations, so the 8-pin and 30-pin will be both come in handy for those as well . One charging cable to use to charge some many different kinds of devices - yeah that is what I call handy. Can't forget to mention the cool looking lights that make it look like "energy" is flowing into the charger then transporting to your devices.Really cool and practical item to have. These would make excellent gifts.Sample for review.

    Rating: 5

    2014-06-10: I have cables all over the place, including a few that simply wouldn’t work with any of my Apple devices. One time I ordered a 30-pin cable for my first generation iPad and was way unhappy when it wasn’t recognized. I was told on the screen, in no uncertain terms, that “Charging is not supported with this accessory.” I may as well have thrown my money out the window.What I especially like, in addition to the instant recognition of the cable, is the fact that I can charge three different types of devices. The cable is not sufficiently heavy-duty to support more than one device at the same time and is not probably not intended to. As soon as I plugged in the 8-pin Lightning pin to my iPad Air, I head the very familiar “blink” and it began to charge.The unique, but not essential visible flow of current is rather cool and I do love it. I’ve had this cable for a couple of months and it continues to perform as expected. Fast, efficient, and ultra-useful. The only problem is that when I use the 8-pin, I have to maneuver it a bit around my case to get it in the port. Otherwise, I’m very pleased with this cable.Sample provided for review.

    Rating: 5

    2014-06-26: This charger came as such a blessing! It can charge the three devices that I need to charge every single day - iPhone, iPad (I have an iPad 2), and Kindle. I wasn't too sure about the quality when I first read the reviews, but after having used the product for a week, I am very pleased with it. it works better than I had expected. The cable has a USB port on one side to plug into a USB adapter or a PC/Mac for charging. The other end has three prongs - the 30-pin adapter, lightning adapter, and a micro-usb adapter. I have not charged all three devices simultaneously yet, but my phone and iPad charge together pretty well. The lighted cable seemed strange at first, but now I am used to it. I personally prefer the cables did not light up so that I could use the cable on my bedside, but it's not a major deal breaker for me. The neat thing is that once the devices are charged, the cable stops blinking.Keep in mind that the cable is not Apple certified, but I have been using non-MFI cables for a several years now and have never had a problem. MFI cables just tend to be double the price of these ones, while these work just as well.Very neat way to keep the desk clutter free with just one cable. Also eliminates the need to have multiple USB adpaters. Well worth the price for the quality of the product!

    Rating: 5

    2014-06-28: I didn't quite know what to expect, but as soon as I plugged in this cable and saw the nifty blue LED lights animate, I flashed back to watching people run wires and cables in Star Trek. Didn't they always light up? This cable, while reducing your total charging current a bit, certainly does look cool and is a lot of fun. You will certainly get comments when people see the power "flowing" from you USB port into your cell phone. It is also convenient to have 3 outputs on the end so you can charge micro-USB, 30-pin, and lightning devices with 1 cable. You can't do them all at the same time, but it allows you to carry just 1 cable in general. It's also cool that the blue LED light show stops when the device is fully charged, a really handy feature. The lightning connector is a bit stepped and extended, so I had no issues plugging it into my iPhone 5S even when inside a moderately sized AmazonBasics case.Recommended fun and frivolous cable that is also quite useful.Note: I received a free sample for the purposes of review.

    Rating: 5

    2014-06-22: This probably my favorite charging cable right now! First of all, it's got 3 heads, Apple 30pin, 8pin and micro-USB. I've tested all of them and they work. The best feature however is the lighting. The cable lights up when it's on and goes off when the device is full. The speed of the moving light is supposed to reflect the battery level but I haven't really noticed that. I just like this because it's versatile and because I like the lights. I highly recommend this. I received this as a review sample from the seller.

    Rating: 5

    2014-07-17: This is a sweet cable that offers entertainment and functionality. Well, not really entertainment but it has these really cool LED lights that flash to show it is charging. It has three plugs, I've used two, on one end and a USB on the other.I've used the micro USB for charging my smartphone and the 30 pin for my iPod. It acts just like an iPod cable and not only charges but syncs as well.They have performed well and have enough clearance for me to charge around a case.The cable has a large USB end that stays put. A really nice cable for multi-device homes. I was provided a sample for review.

    Rating: 5

    2014-07-07: The Wecharger cable is a neat USB charging with LED lights that indicate the rate of charge.It has three different connectors: a lightning adapter for new iOS devices, a dock connector for older iOS and iPod devices, and a microUSB connector for everything else. It appears as though the cable can only differentiate a 1 amp charge from a slower rate of power. It would have been nice for an additional mode to detect a 2 amp power flow. It also had a noticeable plastic smell when I took it out of its packaging.But - and this is a big but - the cable is NOT Apple certified and it will apparently no longer work with Apple devices running the latest iOS updates. Both my iPads rejected the cable after the update was installed. So the lightning plug is all but useless now.DISCLOSURE: Wecharger sent this product to me to review.

    Rating: 2

    2014-06-21: Update 7/12/14The cable is still packed with geekie goodness, but since it is not Apple certified, with the latest Apple update it stopped charging my iPod5G. It still charges my iPod4 and other non-Apple devices, but take note before buying._________________________________________Useful and hypnotizing, this three headed charging cable has a plug that works with the new Apple lightning connectors (8 pin) for iPhones, iPads, iPods, a plug that works with the old Apple connector (30 pin) for iPhones, iPads, iPods and a micro USB connector.These three different plugs eliminate the need for three separate cables, but an added feature is the visually interesting cord with flowing blue lights running its 31 1/2 inch length simulating the electrical current charging the device.I could only charge one device at a time but, conveniently, the flow of the lights slowed and then stopped altogether serving as a highly noticeable indicator when charging is complete. The lights also stop cascading down the cable when the device being charged is unplugged.Performance-wise, all three plugs charged devices without issue, and I had no problem with the cable running hot - at either end of the cord - it all remained cool after hours of use. The package was tightly sealed when I received it -- clearly a new product.Are the running blue lights necessary? No, but they are mesmerizing to watch and ridiculous in the best possible way. The hopeless geek side of my personality is impressed.Cable provided by Wecharger.

    Rating: 4

    2014-05-16: This is the most unique charging cable I've ever used. It has one head with three connectors: micro USB, 30-pin, and lightning. When I charge anything, lights run up the cable to the device, showing the flow of energy. When the charge is slower, the lights move more slowly. When the charge stops, the lights disappear. Love! Now, I know that my devices are charging without having to turn them on or looking for a tiny blink.This isn't a cable you want in your bedroom at night. It's quite bright when you see it in the dark, and there's no way to turn the lights off. In bright daylight, I have the opposite problem. I can't see the running lights for the life of me. If we want to see the lights, we have to use the cable indoors or at night.So far, I've used the cable to charge my iPhone 4S and my tablets and power banks. The only problem I foresee is the micro USB and lightning sides need a lot of clearance. If the case you are using doesn't have much clearance around the micro USB or lightening port, you may have to remove the case.I did try to use the cable for data. It isn't good for that, but as a charging cable, it's great. I don't have to carry around multiple cables or adapters, and I like seeing my devices charge.This product was provided for review by SeaglePower.

    Rating: 4

    2014-06-26: I received this for free but despite that I'll give my candid thoughts below.* Cute visual gimmick that certainly impressed the kids* Three-way plug services iPhone 4, 5 and micro USB but not all at once. There's not room to plug them all in.* Charging output of this is a bit low. About 20% less than a typical cable. Something's gotta be powering those lights.In summary, visually impressive but it costs about 10% of your charging power to move all those lights around on the cord. If you're patient then no worries.

    Rating: 4

    2014-06-22: If you want to have the ability to charge 3 devices at once (as long as one is an iPhone 5+, an Apple device with the 30 pin connector and a microUSB device that is), this cable is perfect. Plug the USB end into your computer or any wall charger. Plug the cable into the proper device and boom, it begin charging.I would recommend not using this in a room where you hope to get some sleep. The flashing light at night could be a distraction you don't want to deal with.In terms of charge capability, I only have an iPhone 5s, nothing with the 30 pin connector. I do, however, have plenty of microUSB chargeable devices. Having the iPhone and my Lumia 1020 plugged in, when I wake up in the morning, both are fully charged. No problem at all.The cable also transfers data, so if you want to connect to your computer for iTunes synch and so on, you can.Recommended!

    Rating: 5

    Rating: 4

    2014-03-18: I used this a handful of times with my Samsung GS3. The phone and it's OEM Samsung Slim Fit case fit in it well. As others have alluded to, it does get damp from sweat. That's a fact; it's only made of cloth so I'd expect no different.The main issue with the product is the headphone cord velcro holster. Again, I haven't used it much and it barely sticks anymore. I don't expect it to hold at all after a couple more uses. The velcro also catches the non-velcro material used elsewhere on the band, leaving it frayed (material/stitching) in areas that a quality product shouldn't.Volume/power buttons were very hard to find/press. On screen functions are acceptable, but absolutely useless while you're wearing it (screen faces away from you), espeically in mid-run.I wouldn't wear an armband when weightlifting period. It just gets in the way.I did a lot of research. You're better off with one of the cheaper, non-plush versions.

    2013-03-04: I use this at the gym with my Galaxy Nexus.     Rating: 5

    2014-02-17: This case does not work well right out of the box if you use it as intended. Knock-on and touch screen functions are unusable when in the case facing up, and the headphone port doesn't line up well. I'm able to fit my phone with Ditztronic slim case, but it's snug.To get around the touchscreen problems, just turn the case upside down so that the open end part of the sleeve is facing upward. Insert your phone so that it's upside down on your arm, but still readable if you were to look down.This does two things. First, the proximity sensor near the top of the phone is no longer covered since the fabric edge doesn't cover it in this position. This is what makes your touchscreen not work, since I suppose it thinks it's in your pocket or up to your ear. Secondly, it lets you plug in your headphones on the big open portion instead of hunting around in the little misplaced hole on the bottom.I've used my tunebelt for a little while now without any real issues. It can be awkward to operate your phone on your arm, but I generally just set it and forget when I start my run. I can reach under the bottom use the buttons, but knock-on works for me as long as the proximity sensor isn't covered. I use my headset with in-line controls to answer calls, change volume, or pause/change music tracks.Aside from the issues specific to the G2, it does run a bit smaller than suggested. My arm is around 16.5", and this band was VERY tight. I had to take it off during my first run, but luckily I knew someone who had an extension band they weren't using, which has been working great.I'm giving this product 4 stars because it's seeming well constructed, but too universal to really fit a phone correctly. I'm sure there's a phone out there that this works great on, but for the G2 you'll need to put it in upside down.

    Rating: 4

    2013-05-16: Not having any luck finding a decent armband for my Galaxy S2, I was hoping this would fit the bill. I'm not that big of a guy for it to have to feel so snug. So unless you're looking to buy the extension, look elsewhere.

    2012-04-01: I've been using this for a couple of months now. I use it when I lift weights at the gym or when out running. The build quality feels good.     Rating: 5

    2013-10-27: I am using this armband with a Samsung Galaxy S4 in an Urban Armor case.The phone and case fit in the Armband very snugly enough that it will not fall out during a run. The top flap does cover the phone with some effort, but even without the top covering the phone, it will not come out during a run. A small push from the bottom and the phone will come out when you want it to come out. The armband does not bounce when running and is very comfortable. The flap does a good job holding extra headphone cord, but in all honesty, if that flap was about 1/4 longer, it would be easier to use.The Armband is made out of neoprene , so it is not weatherproof. As other reviewers have pointed out, sweat can and does seep in from the back. If this is a concern for you, try using a plastic ID holder (Officemate Holders Vertical Inches 37004behind the phone. This will also allow you to carry an ID with you when out for a run.Also, as mentioned the Armband is somewhat small. My arms at about 14” around when flexed. I can get the strap closed, but in reality, I probably could use the extender.Overall I would recommend this case

    Rating: 3

    2013-12-01: This sport armband works well for running. I use my naked Galaxy S4 with the wireless charging cover in this armband. The wireless charging cover makes the GS4 a bit thicker and it fits fine. I've also test fitted a GS4 with theOtterbox Defender case. It doesn't fit with the full case, however if will fit with some effort if you take the outside rubber casing off the Defender case and leave the hard plastic on the phone.The Android 4.3 release for the GS4 enabled ANT+ wireless functionality. I'm waiting for the Garmin 910XT replacement so in the meantime I like using this armband and apps to connect to myANT+ heart rate strap monitorandANT+ footpod. It's a great combo that can alleviate the purchase of expensive GPS watches.I don't run in the rain with this armband. There is a large top slot to slip your phone into and rain can just pour into it. When running on some warm days with the armband against my skin, there was a good amount of moisture inside the neoprene jacket and on the inside of the plastic window. I was a little concerned that this might cause an issue over time.I don't use that silly earphone cable tab on the left side. It's a bit misplaced coming out the side- on the GS4 your earphones would come out the top.When running in cold weather I use a wind jacket and this armband does not stay in place well on my upper arm. It slips down to my elbow, so I either need to cinch the strap very tight or keep my elbow bent so it doesn't fully slip off my arm. The armband should probably be redesigned to use some rubber grips on the inside to keep this from happening. Or else there should be a different model to chose from that has this feature in case you wear slippery athletic clothes.When pressing on-screen buttons I often have to press them many times. The plastic window gets in the way. I don't use a screen protector on the phone. The power and volume buttons are difficult to depress on purpose, yet they unexpectedly get depressed on accident. I only start/stop my exercise so I don't look at it much.This armband works for my purposes and I'll continue to use it. it's not perfect, but it was inexpensive so I'm OK with it for the time being and not looking for an alternative.

    Rating: 4

    2013-07-20: If you buy this armband for your Samsung Galaxy SIII you are quickly going to discover some nifty bonus features! I'll bet you won't find too many other arm bands for your phone that randomly adjust the volume while you're running! Imagine: you're jogging happily down the sidewalk, your Samsung GS3 ensconced withing your Tune Belt Sport Armband for Samsung Galaxy S3, S4 and More(tm) when suddenly the music coming through your earbuds is cranked up to eleven! Hilarity ensues as you go zig zagging down the sidewalk, trying frantically to turn the volume back down. But no, your flailing only increases the volume further! Ho ho ho, what a merry sight!For variety's sake, your Tune Belt Sport Armband will sometimes close the program or activate voice mode on your phone, interrupting the music without warning and making you fight with the phone on your arm through the protective plastic covering, trying to re-open the program you were in!Tune Belt knows you like buying stuff, so they made sure that the standard arm band will not fit most adult male arms and feels like a tourniquet. That way you get to buy an additional extended arm band which adjusts poorly and causes the case to slip!Words cannot describe my love for this quality product after jogging a couple of times with it. Now if you'll excuse me, I am going to go poke my eyes out with forks!

    2013-07-12: I got this for running, and what I like about it is that the strap's Velcro clings tightly to my arm however high or low I mount it. I also like the small Velcro flap that you see in the picture: it lets me tuck in the slack headphone cord so it doesn't bounce around when I run.Unfortunately, the only way to get the Galaxy SIII into the Sport Armband is to take it out of my protective cover and slip just the phone in. I can somewhat easily use the touchscreen through the clear plastic, but I don't expect the body of this armband to protect the phone very well if I drop it.I do sweat a LOT, but so far I haven't soaked the thing enough to make me worry about my phone--the compartment slips the phone in through the top and it doesn't seem that my SIII is going to slide out.Overall, this is a very good case, just with the caveat that I have to take my phone out of its cover to put it in.NOTE: This review was posted under the Sport Armband for Samsung Galaxy S3, S4, and more. If you are seeing the review under another type of phone, be aware that Amazon sometimes does this and we reviewers have no control over it.

  • B00IX307N6

    $B00IX307N6

    2014-06-25: I just got the iSmooth 4ft Charge and Sync Apple Compatible 30-Pin Connecter to USB 2.0 Cable. This is same specs as the OEM Apple 30-Pin Connector that originally came with my Apple devices. The main difference is that the iSmooth cable is cheaper and comes in varying lengths. The iSmooth cable is also Apple MFI Certified, which means it has gone through rigorous Apple certified testing to ensure capability and performance.This cable is compatible with iPhone 3, iPhone 3s, iPhone 4, iPhone 4s, iPad, iPad2, iPad3, iPod classic and iTouch. I tested this on my iTouch, iPhone 4s, and iPad 2 and didn't have any issues to speak of, same as using the original OEM cable.This cable also comes with a no question asked 10 year replacement warranty. If you think this is something you wouldn't end up needing, think again. I stepped on the 30-pin connector side of my OEM cable and ended up cracking it, it still worked but I no longer trust it with my $300+ device. So 10 year warranty is a plus.Overall, I am greatly pleased with this product. I can't tell the difference between the iSmooth cable and the Apple OEM cable. I highly suggest if you are planning on buying a new cable to make sure it is Apple MFI Certified to protect your investment in your device. I rate 5 stars as I can't find any faults with this product.I was provided a sample item for an honest and unbiased review of the item.

    Rating: 5

    2013-07-19: I have an LG Extravert that came with a USB charger, not a wall charger. Out of the blue, the phone wouldn't charge when plugged into the computer, or any of my other USB wall adapters. The Extravert has issues; it only likes to be charged using the cord it came with. OEM and other fitting cords wouldn't work; I did have some luck for a little while using a USB charging pad, but that eventually stopped working as well. I also tried to charge it in the car using a USB adapter for the cigarette lighter, which also, wouldn't charge the phone. I really only purchased this item, admittedly from another website, because it was a 2 pack and one can't have enough adapters. Out of desperation, I began attempting to charge trying the variety of adapters I currently have, which, none worked, but, this is the only adapter that can used to charge my phone! I keep one at home and one at work. I'm thrilled that I can finally charge my phone; hopefully, it won't ever let me down while I own this god awful phone...

    Rating: 5

    Rating: 3

    2012-11-19: Curious that the product description does not tell you the power output specification for this charger. The reason is that the printing on the device says 750mA, presumably split between the 2 USB ports. Compare that to a modern smartphone charger that is at least 1000mA for only one port. This Motorola charger will charge your phone eventually, but really really slowly. That maybe OK if you can let it charge all night (at least 8 hours). Don't bother if you need a fast charge at an airport or coffee shop. And don't even think of using this with a tablet. Tablet chargers are usually 2000mA or more and those still take a while to charge up.

    Rating: 5

    2014-05-01: The charger's output is 750mah. This is horrible because if you want to use both ports at once, that amounts to 375mah per port. That isn't even as much as what you can get from a computer USB port (500mah per USB port on a computer). So it works if you have your devices off and you are charging them overnight. I purchased a few of these for work and regret it now. Just spend extra and get something from Anker that outputs 2-5amps.

    Rating: 1

    2012-12-11: Update: 04-19-2014Use it everyday no problem, nice and compact.I always seem to have one less outlet than I need. This adapter allows you to consolidate "wall-warts". Basically instead of having two usb chargers you can replace them with one.PROS:- Small, great for travel.- Hi density, two ports in the place of one and a very small one at that.- Good build quality.- Metal prongs on plug can fold in.- USB cable plugs in so that it comes straight out. Most USB chargers have a cable connection on the side and often than renders the neighboring outlet useless as it takes up some of its space.Devices this unit will charge:Ipods, iPhones, Android phones & some tablets, Ipads, Bluetooth ear piece, Small portable speakers like the Kinvo, Zune music player, Pocket PC/Windows Mobile Phone, and nearly any device that draws power from USB.

    2013-01-13: The charger does exactly what it is supposed to do, charging two USB items at the same time. I have found however that one of the ports isn't sufficient to charge an Iphone 5 - get a message that says not compatible. Changing to the other port does not produce an error. Not sure why, but past experience is that the power coming out of the ports is probably different different per port - in other words, 1 port might be 1000ma and the other port might be 2000ma. For non-iphone 5, it will charge both items without an error on the device. Ports are not labelled (or my mature eyes cannot see any indication of which port does what). For the money, even if only 1 port worked, it would be worth it. Since it is a Motorola part, it is REALLY worth it.

    2014-06-05: So to change from my original review after taking the unit apart and looking at the circuitry, this product, while it does charge the S5 battery, does not have a proper CC/CV profile charger inside. This means it will not charge your battery properly, and could reduce the lifespan. On top of that, the creepage distance on the 120-240V mains side of the charger is TERRIBLE, it is honestly completely unsafe. If you have one of these chargers I would recommend throwing it in the trash, it is a fire hazard waiting to happen.

    2014-05-31: Nicely made, sturdy, and charges well. Doesn't look all that great, not as good as the oem recharger, but it works ,and its adaptable to other batteries as well. For the price, its a bargain.

    Rating: 3

    2014-06-19: This item feels cheap but it does exactly what it promises. A welcome addition to my s5 accessories. Must have

    Rating: 4

    2014-05-07: It has 800Mha of charging power for the battery. That is double the one I got from "chinese battery guy"

    Rating: 5

    2014-04-26: The idea of a universal charger sounds good, but the implementation of this charger is truly mickey mouse to accomplish this "UNIVERSAL" capability. The display is a nice touch, and it's always nice to see how charged the battery is, however the little charging contacts are the problem. On other wall chargers I've owned these contacts have always been a problem due to the fragile wiper contacts will loose their tension. On this charger the contacts appear to be better from a tension point of view. They use a pin and spring setup, however the flaw in this design is both contact locations can slide up to be adjustable for different width contact locations for different type batteries. The adjustment mechanism is super weak and won't hold a location. If you know anything about lithium ion batteries, you know how dangerous they can be to start fires. If they are shorted, look out, a fire can break out. I don't feel comfortable with these wobbly adjustable contacts, potentially moving around inadvertently and possibly shorting the battery somehow. Since they won't hold a specific contact location, I had to JB WELD them into place for my model battery. And to do that I had to confirm the contact assignments on my battery since it had 4 contacts. Although they were marked, only two our of four contacts were marked. I confirmed three of the four contacts are used, having one ground, two positives and one no-connect. Since my charger has only two contacts, I assume that making contact with only one of the 2 positive contacts will work OK. I'm going to watch it closely while charging for the first few times. I think the JB WELD epoxy will fix the adjustment flaw in this charger, turning it into a fixed contact width charger for my battery. I highly recommend you buy a different charger made specifically for your battery, in my case a Galaxy S5 battery. You'll be much happier not worrying about if the contacts are making proper contact. Another issue with the S5 battery is the mechanical shape, it's somewhat long. Since the battery fits in charger sideways it sticks way out to the side of the charger. It can't be used in certain sockets I'm use to using to charge my phone, however for most this might not be the case.

    Rating: 2

    2014-06-30: Really simple product that works like a champ. It has a status light that indicates when the battery is full. It also comes with a usb port so it can work both as battery charger and cellphone charger at the same time...Awesome!

    Rating: 5

    2012-04-16: Best case I have bought for my iPhone since I got it. Fits great, feels good in your hand and is very secure during drops etc. I have bought 3 of this brand and style case and have been very happy with them all.

    2012-04-18: I got two of those. One for my new iPhone 4S and the other one for my son's 4S. He is away at school so at first I was not concerned about confusing my phone with his. However the first time he came to visit it did turn out to be a problem. So I decided to get myself a case of a different color. I liked this black Slash - it felt snug and non-slippery in my hand and it provided like 1/32 of an inch protection edge for the screen (as when you put the phone down with the screen down the glass will not actually touch the surface of the table as it sits on the edge protruding around the perimeter of the phone). They did not not have a SLASH case in a color acceptable to me, so I went with this silver oneCaseCrown Metallic Glider Case for Apple iPhone 4 and 4S (AT&T;, Sprint, & Verizon compatible) - Silver. It is also a nice case. Also easy to put on and also provides protection for the screen - not as much though - may be 1/64 vs. 1/32 in the Slash model. However the silver case is not non-slippery - it is really smooth - not unlike the iPhone 4S without the case. I don't think it is going to be a huge problem, but it is not as easy to securely handle the phone while taking it out of the front pocket of my jeans. The way it feels in my hands is different. Very smooth. But not as secure. I guess as far as how it feels against my palm - I like the smooth feel better. However if they had a SLASH in a manly color other than black, I would have preferred to stay with the non-slippery SLASH model.

    Rating: 5

    2013-12-25: I've had the iPhone 4 for a year and a half, and had cases of all types - the big honkin' Otterbox and $2 crap I found elsewhere. This is far and away the best. I was worried it would be soft and rubbery, that it would be a loose fit, that the lower end would break, that the two halves wouldn't stay together. All these fears were groundless. Best one by far. Simple, sturdy, solid, stays put. Get it. If you have a 4, you need it.

    2012-06-08: Nice iphone 4 or 4s case, hard and also is lite, black color goes with the device color and fits perfect on the telephone. I hope you will enjoy it.

    Rating: 5

    2013-03-29: After shattering my iPhone screen, I wanted a case with a slight lip to protect the screen if dropped face down. Overall protection would be a plus as well. Finally, I wanted something that wasn't bulky and most importantly discrete, so no wild design or bright logos. This case hit all my points.This slider is a nice snug fit, nice lip around the screen and not bulky. The matte black finish is neither smooth nor rubbery, nor does it feel cheap.Overall, very happy with this case.

    Rating: 5

    2013-05-07: This is an excellent case and the price is right. The case is made of a smooth and comfortable material. There are some grooves on each side to assist in holding without slippng. It arrives in two parts making it very easy to slide onto the iphone where it fits perfectly. The cutouts are exactly placed so as to allow access to all the features. Obviously there was serious thought given to the design and the manufacturing of this outstanding case. I have purchased other cases and none of them are of the quality of this one. I would have preferred that this had been manufactured in the USA rather than China but I must admit that it is one heck of a fine case.

    Rating: 5

    2013-12-18: After I broke this case the first time, I tried to find a better suiting case for me (slim, sleek, and functional) but I ended up buying this again. I love being able to slide in and out of my pocket almost as if there was not case on at all.My advice, don't slide the case apart frequently, it will eventually become loose and break.

    2013-05-18: This was not worth $17!! I could have gotten the same thing at 5 Below!! It didn't have a perfect fit either.

    Rating: 1

    2012-05-14: I've owned a variety of cases over time. I started out with an iFrogz case that lasted a few months but eventually the plastic near the screen and the volume buttons snapped off. I will say that I dropped the phone a few times however that's the reason I bought a case. I knew that would happen on occasions. I also had an Otterbox Defender case which kept my phone protected pretty well up until the time I dropped it on some concrete which caused one of the internal mics to break. Luckily I got the phone replaced for free at the Apple store. Another case I owned was manufactured by Splash. It was almost identical to the CaseCrown one I'm reviewing. I loved the case as it was simple and provided more than adequate protection for my phone. I had some issues with the rubber wearing off and after contacting their CS and not receiving a response for a replacement (even after I had previously submitted a positive review online) I ditched it. I tried another CaseCrown case. A red one that snapped down the middle of the phone, top to bottom. It worked well but eventually the plastic near the top snapped. Eventually I bought the CaseCrown Splash Glider Case. I've had it for some time now and can't speak highly enough about it. The case fits the phone snug. The joint between the top of the case and the bottom that snaps together seems well connected. This has been tested with accidental drops. The case exterior isn't wearing off like I experienced with the other cases. The biggest test is dropping the phone by accident on multiple occasions (a few times on concrete) and the phone taking no damage due to the protection of the case. Overall a great product especially for the price. It's simple which appeals to my tastes also. The case adds a little depth to the phone but not enough to make it really any tougher to store it in your pocket.

    Rating: 5

    2011-12-27: have been using this case on my ATT iphone 4s for a week now and it's perfect. it's thin and not too big, but still feels very solid, and offers good protection. the case feels very nice in your hands and doesn't feel like it's going to slip out. have no problems taking my phone out of my pocket.the only slight issue i have with this case is the amount of fingerprints it attracts. i used to use the incipio ngp black matte, which didn't attract many fingerprints at all.however, this isn't a deal breaker for me. it functions great as a case for my iphone.5 stars.

I tried the same with the screen protector that came with the case, but it did the same. It's not a big deal as it comes with a lay on the table design. The ports are all easily accessible and non of the buttons are hard to reach. All in all this is a very solid cause and I would recommend it.

    Rating: 5

The thickness of the case is appropriate and provides excellent protection and especially excellect grip. The edge around the face is raised enough to permit safe face down placement on a surface. I will not hesitate to buy this case again.

    2011-06-03: I bought this for an HTC Inspire, though the packaging indicated HTC Desire -- same phone body, or so I hear. I impulsively bought a gel case almost identical to this one (except in purple, the only color in stock) at Best Buy. I had wanted a case immediately and it did the job, but I got tired of the girly purple. So I gave this case a try. This case was literally one fourth the price of the one from Best Buy, yet the difference in quality between the name brand and this likely "knock off" is negligible. Both appear to be made of the same smooth, rubber-like material; both are about the same thickness; both fit the phone snugly. There is one place, on the front top (earpiece) area, where the expensive case was slightly more customized to the opening. However, on the reverse side, the holes for the camera lens and flash were incredibly precise on this case, whereas they weren't on the much more expensive case from Best Buy. In terms of looks, this case is more professional and mature looking...it is a smoky clear case with subtle circle patterns. The phone color and logo show through, but there is some tint. As far as I can tell, it offers the same basic level of protection as the rubber skin case I replaced. Bottom line: At less than $5, it is a great deal. You will pay two, three, or four times as much at a retail store.

    2011-08-11: First, it is cheap.It doesn't make the phone feel huge, although obviously it must add something. In particular it feels a little thicker. It isn't loud, which is the only real criteria I have.Doesn't seem to interfere with GPS performance, which is a concern I have seen voiced with respect to cases.The buttons work OK despite being covered. There are extra padded sections that cover the button and put pressure in the right place when you press down on them.Finally, I can report that it serves one major purpose of a rubberized style case like this - I have dropped the phone a few times with no noticeable dings or performance issues as a result.

    2011-06-09: Pros: Inexpensive. Well made. Looks great! Unisex color. Fits perfectly on my HTC Inspire 4G, but is not too hard to take off like some TPU cases are.     2013-04-11: I am really loving this phone. The screen is fantastically vibrant and sharp. I love the stylus (Draw Something is so much more fun with it), the software is great and the phone really hums along.     Rating: 5

    2012-12-11: I really am loving this device. More than I thought I would. The screen is beautiful and big, fast, smooth, and bright. Very little downside for me.PROS:--Bright Screen--Fringer Print coating - I haven't heard anybody talk about the coating on the screen, but it is one of my favorite feature! It is like working on silk, and it doesn't pick up finger print even close to what my previous phones did. REally has a luxury feel.--Battery life - HUGE factor for me. I can get through a regular moderate use day, and still have 30-40% batter when I get home. CRAZY GOOD! This can even be improved with tighter control over the settings for sure.--Removable battery - AND if the giant 3100mAh batter isn't enough, you can swap it out!--Speed - FAST FAST FAST!--SD card slot - up to 64BG on top of the 16GB on board--Android 4.1 Jelly Bean - I think they have finally passed iOS with this version. Super fast smooth, and TON of cool gesture features available.--LED light on the front is great for notification without having to turn on the phone--Home Button - At 1st I didn't like it, but with such a big phone, it is really handy to beable to wake it up with the home button, and not have to reach up the side--Design- much improved over the Note I - thinner, buttons are more reachable. Very premium feel, even though it is all plastic. I'm surprised how much I like it.--Camera - lots of cool features and effects, and it is SUPER FAST--Touch Wiz - lots that I'm not a huge fan of, but the lock screen widgets are great. Otherwise, I switched to Nova Launcher, and LOVE IT! This really sold the device for me. Touch wiz isn't great, but not horrible either. Nova Launcher erases most of the annoyance for me (including having to look at Verizon Bloat ware in the app drawer) - SO EASY TO CUSTOMIZE!--S-PEN - I almost forgot! Very easy to use, needs more apps, but the ones that work well are beautiful. It writes almost better than a regular pen.--Phone - volume on the speaker and ear piece are fine. Very load and clear.LOVE THIS PHONE!CONS--Touch Wiz - The settings are scattered all over, some in the settings, some in the individual apps. More centralized would be better. customized notification bar is so-so. Wish I could re-arrange the icons and shrink them. Pure JellyBean is much better (ESPECIALLY on 4.2).--Size - NOT A CON for me! I used my old iphone last night and it felt like a tiny little toy. Almost unusable. I love the giant screen, but if you have small hands it will probalby be too big. I'm 6" with large hands, but it is easier to drop...--Very Slick - I had to get a case because it is so smooth and slippery. Very easy to drop. I found a decent bumper case that isn't too bulky, and adds enough grip to feel more comfortable.Anything else..... NOT REALLY! Android apps aren't always the best available, but the level of customization is so huge, It is worth breaking out of the Apple and Microsoft walled gardens. (Yes, I said Microsoft too! - just spend two years with WP7, and it is just as closed as apple...IMO)

    Rating: 5

    2013-07-08: got this phone as a gift for someone. it works really well, has great battery life, wonderful screen, very smooth operation.

    Rating: 5

    2013-03-12: The Note 2 is my second smartphone. My previous device was a Moto Droid X and I loved it. My life was changed when I got my Droid X - I had almost instant access to every bit of data that I could possibly need. I'm not a particularly organized person, and having a smartphone helped me keep up with a busy life.After nearly 2 years, the Droid X was showing its age. 512MB of RAM and a single core processor isn't much these days. I was stuck on Android 2.3 (Gingerbread) with no upgrade in sight. ICS based roms were available, but Motorola's decision to lock down the phone meant that functionality was missing from ICS roms. It was time to shop for a new phone.The Note 2 caught my eye immediately. The large screen was a huge draw. I have a tablet, but it was too big to carry on a daily basis. My Droid X had a 4.3" screen, but reading documents on it caused eyestrain. The 5.5" Note 2 screen was just big enough to be a decent e-reader but small enough to fit in my pocket. It also weighs almost the same as the Droid X.The battery was another big plus. The battery in this phone is gigantic by smartphone standards. 3100 mAh is nothing to scoff at, compared with the Droid X's 1540 mAh. Many users have reported full-day performance with the Note 2. With my Droid X, I learned quickly to have a charger at home, at work, in the car, and in my backpack. In my first couple of days with this device, I have been using it heavily and going to bed at the end of the day with 20% or so left on the battery. That's impressive.The construction feels solid. Not as solid as the metal body of the Droid X, but well put together. All of the buttons feel great, with no wiggle or soft actuation. For such a large device, it fits into my hand well. The finish is slightly slick, and I'm handling it with kid gloves until I can get a case on it.Internally, the phone is well laid out. When you pop off the back cover, the battery, SIM, and MicroSD are all immediately accessable. A plastic overlay covers and protects the other internal components. I particularly like that I can insert and remove the MicroSD card without taking out the battery - A big gripe of mine with the Droid X was that I had to remove the battery to do that.Software-wise, I'm impressed with both Jellybean and Samsung's Touchwiz. Jellybean brings a lot of small but important updates to Android, and Touchwiz is a functional and nice looking software suite. Contrast this with Motorola's Blur, which I never really liked. The S-pen is amazing. I've not used it for anything "serious" yet, but for drawing, taking notes, and navigating the UI, it's pretty slick. I'm still experimenting with the split window functionality, but that's a neat feature as well.Performance wise, the phone is a hotrod. Apps download and install in seconds. Launching apps is nearly instantaneous. Switching between running apps is seamless. When streaming bluetooth audio to my car, I used to get pauses and interruptions in the audio. Not any more. It just plays.The display is equally impressive. The colors are bright and text is sharp. There are 4 color "levels" that you can choose from, from oversaturated to muted. I'm still deciding which level I prefer.This phone won't change my life as much as my first Android phone. The Droid X was a huge shift for me. The Note 2 is all that and a bag of chips. The larger screen, longer battery life, and scorching performance just make a great thing into a fantastic thing.tl;dr Great phone!

    Rating: 5

    2013-03-12: Amazing phablet in every way: size, screen, speed, memory, performance etc.. Actually I truly think its the best phone in the world at the present time. The only little issue I found after 2 months of use is the location of the power button, the massive size of the phone makes you want to hold it from the edges if you want to avoid holding it from the screen, holding the phone from the edges often causes the accidental pushing of the power/wake/sleep button, much rather it was placed on top like Motorola phones. But folks that's the only negative thing i found. If you like the size of this phone, which I do and wish it was even bigger, you will absolutely love love this phone.Buy and enjoy highly recommend it!!!!!!!!!!

    2013-10-02: Now, I'm no tekki and often times somewhat technologically impaired, so I can only speak to you in plain simple language. I love the big screen. The reading part of the screen is about 2 3/4 by 4 1/2 -- much larger than my previous smart phone. This phone is fairly simple to operate the basics on and you can go to Google and download the detailed manual for free. It's a slim phone, probably about a half inch on the side and a little more than 6 inches by 3 1/4 on the outside. Slides nicely into most ladies' purses. If you are a belt-wearer, you probably want to get an Otterbox case for durability. Besides all the nice apps and the ability to actually write on it with a stylus pen, the stylus pen slides right inside the phone for storage.BTW, for those on the edge of buying, you might get this model a little cheaper now, because I understand the Galaxy Note III is scheduled to come out in about a month or less.This is a fun phone :)

    Rating: 5

    2013-02-13: There are already some excellent reviews, so I am going to try not repeating what has already been written. Instead, I am going to list a few reasons why I love this phone, plus one big caveat. The caveat first: when I got my first smartphone - a Motorola Droid X - I was equally pleased at this point in the ownership cycle. At month 18 that phone became a nightmare. So, factor that in as I gush about how great this phone is.My comparisons are going to be to the Droid X:- I cannot believe the battery life! I am no longer tethered to a charger. One three hour phone conversation dropped my battery to 73 percent. And it charged back up to 100% when I did plug it into a charger in less than 20 minutes. Note: this is a relatively new phone with a new battery. I doubt I would get the same results a year from now when the battery is worn by numerous charging cycles. Still, since I routinely go the entire day without charging it, only putting it on charge when I go to bed, the wear and deterioration of the battery will probably be far less than for other phones.- Boot-up time is amazingly quick. My previous phone took what seemed to be forever to come up in a ready state after restarting it or powering it back on. This one does it in literally seconds.- Signal strength is as good, if not better, than the phone it replaced. That was a relief because I had heard horror stories about this and the S III. In fact, the Motorola phone was legendary for it's antenna and receiving/transmitting systems and this phone is certainly its equal.- Speaker volume and reception are vastly superior to the Motorola.I transferred my SD card directly from my Droid X to this phone and all of its contents were immediately recognized by the Note 2. I did have to recreate my play lists for my music, which may have been stored in the internal memory of the Droid X. Still, that was a relief to not have to recreate everything.Although this phone is supposed to be locked down I have added apps to it with no problems, so for me that aspect is not an issue.One accessory that I found to be essential to protect the phone is anEvecase Leather Wallet Case with Stand and Credit Card Holder for Samsung Galaxy Note 2 II N7100 - Black.As for the size - it is not a problem for me. In fact, I an getting older and the larger form factor - while not cool or trendy - suits me perfectly.The phone is, if anything, too responsive. The screen is sensitive to your every touch. Sometimes my finger lands or overlaps areas adjacent to where I wanted to touch and the phone responds before I can correct it. That is a minor issue and many folks will probably not experience it.Since this phone is practically a tablet I purchased anHDE Silver Wireless Bluetooth 3.0 Keyboard, which makes it super-easy to use for web surfing and creating and developing documents with Polaris Office 4.0 that shipped with my phone.If there is anything to complain about it's Verizon itself. I had to change from my unlimited data plan to their far more restrictive one in order to upgrade. I am not pleased about that and consider it to border on unethical. I've been with Verizon since 1999 and have been very loyal - until now. And since this reviews is about Verizon's version of this phone I think my comment about this is valid.On the iPhone vs. Galaxy comparisons: I have friends who have iPhones and they have admired my Note 2, but are not about to switch. I can see their point. They are comfortable with that device's interface and features and have no compelling reason to switch. I mention this because that comparison seems to frequently crop up and it truly has no relevance in my opinion. Most folks who are used to Apple are probably going to stay with that platform, and the newer ones seem to have close to the same features judging from one of my friend's 4S model.As I mentioned above, time will tell about this phone. Right now I am thoroughly pleased with mine, but who knows? Latent flaws could surface in the future that change my opinion. If so I will come back and update this review.

    Rating: 5

    2013-07-14: This is one of the most affordable and reliable external battery for a Smartphone in the market. It's thin, lightweight, and build is of superb quality, it's sleek and will greatly compliment your iPhone 5.It can provide 1-1.5 full charge cycle to an iPhone 5. I also love the battery meter where you can monitor progress in charging and juice left.The package came with several cables and adapters but not a lightning charging cable. I use my Kindle charging cable to charge this device. But the cables and adapters that came with it are made of quality materials and would definitely get you started on utilizing this external battery.Anker needs to replace the flashlight button as it can unknowingly be turned on, thus draining the battery. Had two unpleasant experiences with this in the past, hoping Anker can device a lock for the flashlight switch or fashion a different kind of switch that isn't the push button type.I highly recommend this external battery for everyday commute. I own two of these and I always keep one on both of my bags.

    2013-05-18: I was really excited when I received my Anker portable charger, as I had done some extensive research on chargers and felt Anker best fit the bill. I keep multiple chargers and cords with me at all times and thought it was time to invest in something that combined all my charging needs into one compact unit.I'm sad to say Anker hasn't quite convinced me this was the product I needed. I felt sure that it would live up to its promise and charge my devices multiple times. I still feel this is a solid product, but am sorely disappointed in the fact that it only charges my Samsung Galaxy S II once fully. I fail to understand how a 3200mAh capacity can only fill a battery once.On a positive note, I feel the device's portability and built in connectors still make it a great priduct for people on the go. You can't beat the price and Anker is still a quality brand. Before purchasing this charger, I would suggest you take a look at your charging needs from day to day and assess if you can prioritize the charging of this product in addition to your mobile devices.

    2012-11-30: You take your chances when ordering online without actually being able to touch the product, but I have to say that this charger exceeded my expectations. It seems to charge my phone pretty quickly, too.     Rating: 5

    2013-04-18: I chose this product because of a number of factors. First, it looked fairly compact, although smaller devices in different shapes do exist. The price was fair, and I liked that it had a built in flashlight, because nothing says VALUE like MULTITASKING. :) I also like how the mini-USB attachment is built in, many other devices require that you carry a separate cord to use it. If you only need a mini-USB connection, then no extra cords are required. It also has a female mini-USB and regular USB connection at the top so you can also use this to charge other devices (like an older ipod/iphone connection, for example).The device is about the same size as my ipod classic and is very light. I liked that it came in white or black. Out of the box, it was nearly fully charged (the readings go in increments 25%, 50%, 75%, 100%). I hooked it up to charge it to capacity and it has a nice light feature to tell you when it's fully charged. The lights blink as it's charging, when it's done, the lights go solid. Very helpful. Took about 5 minutes to be fully charged.I've only had it a few days, but I've used it to charge my phone up from 50% capacity about 3 times and it's still showing 75% power. My phone seems to charge slowly, but it is slow to charge regardless if it's hooked up to the laptop or directly into the wall, so I'm not faulting this device for that issue.I'm taking off one star because it comes with a "power cord" that doesn't work on this device. The instructions show you that it's supposed to come with a cord that has a USB connection on one end and a mini-USB connection on the other. This cord has a regular USB port on one side and a circular port on the other. The circular connector doesn't fit on this device at all. It doesn't look like any connector I've ever seen, so I don't think I have any use for it at all. It seems like this might have been a mistake since the illustration shows a different (and useful) cord. It's not enough of an issue for me to return this item since I have several USB/mini-USB cords lying around, but it would be incredibly inconvenient if you're expecting a cord to use this with. Other than that, I'm satisfied that I got a good product at a good value.

    2012-10-04: Anker is a fine product though I'd never heard of it. The 2600mA (milliamp)battery is solidly constructed, and while slim and easily slipped into pant's/jean pocket, has a weighty-substantive feel. It has a piano-finish, high gloss shell (really nice). The charger boasts a MICRO port for charging ease, and comes (this is best part)with a micro-tip charger nestled smartly in the side of devices, attached to 2-3 inch coiled wire. Just long enough to get your charge on.This charger will give my Motorola RAZR phone an almost complete re-charging. By the time it's done this, your charger is dead. But, not bad, mission accomplished. For those interested in better understanding: My RAZR phone has a 2600 mA battery. So Charger at 2600mA, phone holds 2600mA. Being so happy with the Anker product, I passed on buying thier 5600mA product (the 5600 would nicely recharge your phone TWICE with little trouble) and went for the insurance of the "[Upgraded Version] Anker Astro2 Dual USB Output 8400mAh Backup External Battery Pack Charger with built-in Flashlight", also purchased on Amazon. This puppy should allow me to charge my smart phone several times a day with plenty of back-up for another day, perhaps more. I'll never run out...smile. Your tablet/Android/iOS/ should be a cinch for the 8400mA device as well.The 8400mA is slim as well, a bit thicker, not by much, still fine in trouser/jeans pocket, so no worry there. Anker has sent E-mail after each purchase asking for feedback and general thoughts. They seem genuinely concerned with the reputation they hold in the marketplace. Always a good sign.Highly recommended!

    2012-07-01: In this generation, we are lost without our cellular devices. We use it for work, for communication, for entertainment etc. With all these wonderful features in our phones, we tend to become reliant on them. However, everyday we all tend to experience mini heart attacks because we are always faced with situations where we need our phone for an important task but battery is close to being over. Let's face it, smartphones have very poor battery life.Thankfully there are cheap and great alternatives and this happens to be one of them.Let's get to the product. This works with almost every phone. It has a built in plug which you can just connect to your phone and it will start charging right away. For iPhone users however, you need to connect your usb and then charge, which isn't a big deal. The product has indicators on it letting the user know how much battery life is left using led display, which is very helpful. You can connect this to your phone and while it is charging, you can keep your phone on use and it will supply the power. One great little feature this product has is a built-in flashlight. Now your thinking, what do I need a flashlight for? trust me I thought the same thing and that little gadget actually came in handy in my everyday life while I was out. Its a nice little addition we can all enjoy. The size of the product is about the size of a credit card and it is very slim. It is very light in weight and sometimes you might forget your even carrying it in your pocket.The only bad thing about this product is that it is not 3200mAh. I have a Samsung Galaxy S2 and a 3200mAh battery should give me atleast 2 full charges, however this external charger only gives me about 1 full charge. Overall for the price, this is a very solid product and saved me many times. If your tired of waking up in the morning and realizing you forgot to charge your phone, well this is your solution. Wherever you are or whenever it is, your phone's battery life will now be one less headache to worry about.Additional information - The customer service for Laptopmate is amazing. I chose standard shipping for my item but they sent it to me using priority mail so I was able to receive it faster. Little things like that can give you assurance that your purchase is appreciated.Anker also provides this product with a 18 month warranty and instructions on how to report complaints or problems with your device or service. The Anker family wants nothing short of 100% customer service and they are doing a wonderful job providing great quality that is hard to find these days. Go with this product, you will have nothing to worry about.I hope I helped! if you have any questions let me know and I will answer as soon as possible. Thank you so much for reading my review!Edited*As of 11/7/2012 this product is still providing me with wonderful service, I have used it almost everyday for the past four months and I have not experienced anything negative so far.     2011-10-01: Bought this 4 months back for my HTC Inspire 4G. Been using this quite regularly - almost every day to the office.Works sturdy and so far, it hasn't snapped or torn in any place (Of course, my handling of the product also deserves a mention :- Would recommend to anyone.One caveat: If you are planning on putting a skin to your mobile and then use this pouch, I would suggest using a hard mobile cover and not silicone/rubber-based. With a silicone/rubber case, there is tremendous friction created when you put in/remove the phone out of the pouch. This might result in some early damages to your phone & pouch.Some of the reviews in Amazon mentions about a strong magnetic lock for this product which reportedly harms the phone. I haven't seen that problem in mine. The magnetic lock is strong enough to hold the phone but seems to do no damage beyond.

    2011-11-03: Some have complained about the magnetic strip placement interfering with their devices operation, but for my motorola bionic, it's perfect. Others have also mention that with the default attachment the holster could slide sideways and your phone could slip out. I've not had this problem. I like the quality, the appeal and am recommending this holster to anyone who has a Motorola Droid Bionic and is looking for a quality protective case.

    Rating: 5

    2014-04-16: Mine broke within the first 3 weeks... I wasn't really satisfied with the quality... Nothing to be done about it now, I suppose...

    Rating: 2

    2011-01-18: Purchased this 'holster' along with droid pro xt610 hard case and I am very please with both. Don't always use the pouch but there are times when it is easier to carry the phone in it rather than a pocket. The droid pro in the hard case fits very nicely. There have been times when I thought the swivel would have been better than the belt loop but think you can buy it separate, however I'm learning to like the belt loop.

    Rating: 5

    2012-02-24: Even though the Samsung Galaxy S2 i9100 International Version is such an exquisite phone naked; it, like any other high-end electronic device, is prone to being scratched or dropped. So after extensive "research" for practical phone-protected carry, here enters the Dickies Active Duty case.There aren't many case choices for the Galaxy S2 at present; or at least ones that I'd like to use (I'm a case snob). There's either a barely there-type cover which snaps on the back leaving the top, front and bottom exposed or a slip-in and then there's the fold-over flap design that leaves the corners and part of the top open to potential damage. Neither of these cases come with built-in belt clips so you're stuck carrying the phone in your pocket, purse, or whatever you use to transport your phone. Just not your belt. I didn't like neither of these options because of the conditions mentioned and I needed something to put the phone in to travel with it that would protect the screen. I like to keep my phone completely protected as much as possible and in my pocket instead of in my hand all the time and like to have it protected, but easily accessible wherever I went. I bought this Dickies and also the Trident AG-SGX2-BK AEGIS case with hopes the Trident would fit and fortunately it did even knowing that the Dickies case would be too large for the phone alone according to past Dickies reviews.As previous reviewers have pointed out and to my disappointment, the snap on the front flap IS purely there for aesthetic reasons and not as a reinforced fastener that a Maxpedition would provide. The magnet on the flap and case are also very weak which could be a good thing since I read somewhere that it could affect the functionality of the phone. But it's a bad thing too because the flap is just that, a flap and offers no security of holding the phone in the case unless it's in the upright position. The magnets just aren't strong enough to keep it closed so don't expect to use this case without an additional case or cover on any phone you put in there because it will definitely move around and more than likely fall out if the case is pushed to its side or placed upside down. This is why I had to deduct a star. The inside of the case is so spacious that two Samsung GS2's could probably fit which is why you would need an additional cover or case to take up the extra space. I took this into consideration and lucked out because the Trident fit so perfectly almost like it was made specifically for the Dickies. See the pictures I uploaded for yourself.The Trident sits snugly and since it has a silicone outer ring, the Dickies case hugs it with no slippage once the Trident is inside. This combination I have now gives me the face in protection the Otterbox Defender or Ballistic cases would have given me.On another note, this Dickies case doesn't come with a belt clip, but offers a Dickies brand clip as a separate accessory at an additional cost which is questionable because it should have been included. I was going to get it, but since their clip had bad reviews, I opted to buy a non-swiveling Krusell SpringClip (58301) and it fits and works flawless and is cheaper clip than Dickies clip.

    Rating: 4

    2011-07-31: I liked this for quite a while. I needed one that didn't tilt. Did wish it had a clip (not loop). This does catch on chair arms - as many do - but it's tearing across the top of the loop. Maybe I'm just hard on them? Anyway, the "Rugged" of "Dikies RUGGED Pouch" isn't playing out. Looking at Maxpedition now, as their stuff is seemingly bulletproof.

    Rating: 3

    2011-07-10: The quality of this pouch is overall pretty good. There are three reasons, however, that I gave it two stars. 1) It is over three times as expensive as a similar-quality pouch made by Reiko (see my related review). 2) When used with a belt through the belt-loop with your shirt hanging over the pouch (rather than tucking your shirt in), you can feel the plastic multidapt clip adapter rubbing on your skin. This problem would be eliminated, I'd imagine, if you bought the actual multidapt clip separately--but there goes even more money down the drain. 3) It claims to be a universal pouch for many phones including the Samsung Focus, but it does not fit it well at all. The pouch is a little too short for the magnetic clasp to close all the way if your Focus has a case on it, and the pouch is a good half an inch too wide to hold the phone snugly.Obviously, if you have a different sized phone than the Samsung Focus (4.84 x 2.56 x 0.39 inches +case), problem #3 would not be applicable, but be wary of the first two issues. Just to roughly estimate, I would think the pouch would be better suited for a phone that was closer to 4-4.5" tall, around 3" wide, and up to .5" thick (+case).Overall, while decently made, the quality is no better than other holsters I've owned for a fraction of the cost.

    Rating: 2

    2010-10-26: I Love the vertical style and I love evenly the fact that it has a belt LOOP not clip. This ENSURES that this case is not going anywhere! I love the Strong Leather that it has, does not feel cheap at all and the fact that it fits my phone. (PERFECTLY) I would recommend this case to ANYone who has a EPIC, EVO, DROID X, ETC as this case is the perfect one for me!

    Rating: 5

    2011-09-13: This is a perfect fit for the Samsung Droid Charge. You will not be able to have a "glove" on the phone while it's in the case. However otherwise this droid fits in like perfect, no shaking or pulling down the top. And I've tried a number of pouches for this droid and none fit as well nor are made as well as this pouch.Magnet closure does NOT make the screen go on or off. No effect on the phone. And I like the magnet closure as you are sure it closes.In the pictures you are seeing the front of the pouch. That is "snap" closure is nothing more than a decoration.I would of given this full stars, but I'm taking one away as there is no clip (or preferably a rotating clip) on it nor one that you can purchase. The one that's recommended in the description is for a web type tool belt. That clip will NOT work on a regular belt, your pants, shirt, etc. IF you have a tool belt, you probably would be very happy with that clip. Otherwise it will not work.The back is nothing more than (fastened on both ends with an opening in the middle) a secure area to run your belt or strap through. I cannot think of a scenario where this pouch would fall off your belt or strap. It's very secure. Your belt would have to break or come off. And it's very wide, I've never seen any mens belts that would not fit this.Or if you have a bag you want to keep your droid in so to not scratch the phone or such, this pouch is for you.I spoke with customer service for this company and they cannot find a clip that will work for this phone. I'm very surprised that the designers of this did not include the option for a rotating clip. I know some do not like clips, but I like 360 degree rotating clips.Now I THINK you can purchase a self glue on clip. I've not seen any that rotate of this type. However I'm reluctant to use it as once you put it on, it may or may not stick properly and could make a mess of the leather.If you are looking for a rugged pouch for a Samsung Droid Charge. You need a belt or strap of some type you can put it on, by opening the belt/strap each time you want to remove the pouch. There is no way to open the back of the pouch as it's securely sewn on both sides.

    2013-11-06: Okay so I got this so I could Skype while lying in bed on my Samsung Galaxy S4.The gooseneck is strong and sturdy made out of metal. It is painted white. The clips have foam and won't damage whatever you mount it to nor your phone. I mounted mine on my lamps pole. So the arm extends out horizontally. The clips have strong springs. The mounting spring is about 5-10 pounds of pressure to get them to open and about 3 pounds for the phone. This holds well. Both the arm and the suction cup are spherical gimbles to which the cell phone clip attaches to. So you can rotate and tilt in all sorts of ways. so the bummer part is that the package only comes with one phone clip. so you end up using either the arm or the suction not both.

    Rating: 4

    2013-12-08: Very well built! I was surprised at how stury this thing is! It could easily support the heaviest tablet if you had a way to connect it. The clip that connects the arm to furniture is very strong and both clips are covered with a felt-like material to prevent scratching. I am very pleased with this product!

The vise type clamp that is on it works, but be careful if you move the goose neck, it will move with it and slip off or cause minor damage to whatever you have it clamped too. all in all its pretty ok, but I sent mine back.

    2013-10-06: This is a nice product to charge a USB gadget (up to 1 AMP) while also leaving the plug available for another gadget like a GPS. The blue LED lit ring around the USB port is a nice plus, and so is the safety cap for when you're not using the 12V socket. I think the unit is reasonably sized, not too big but not compact either.However, I have to deduct one star because, at least for me, it did not seem to stay firmly plugged in. I had to push it in a few times. My outlet is horizontal and perhaps the unit was a bit bulky for my small car and/or I accidentally did something to make loosen and break the connection. You may or may not have this issue depending on your configuration, so keep this in mind. Make sure you have the room for it and a socket placement that will make the weight of the unit (plus whatever is plugged into it) keep it firmly in the socket (if it sticks out horizontally then you may be more likely to have problems keeping it firmly connected in the socket).NOTE: I received a free product sample for review.

    Rating: 4

    2013-10-25: I was provided with this USB car charger free of charge by Yubi Power in exchange for my honest review.There are probably hundreds of different USB car chargers on the market and I have tried several different brands and types. When comparing the quality of this USB car charger to other chargers I would consider this about average. What's nice about this one is that you don't lose the ability to use your cigarette lighter socket. This adapter plugs into the socket and then you can use the socket on this adapter along with the USB port to charge your electronic devices. I have been using it to charge by iPad and it has worked perfectly. I like the blue LED light on the front because it really comes in handy at night. The bright light doesn't bother me at night but it may bother some people. Overall this is a simple USB charger but it's low cost and gets the job done. No complaints from me.

    Rating: 4

    2013-10-23: I use a lot of gadgets in the car, but the lack of charging outlets usually prevents me from using more than a couple at the time. This charge splitter is a great answer to those dilemmas: it allows me to connect a USB-charging device while leaving the cigarette lighter socket available for another use. Granted, most modern devices today use USB charging to begin with, so a dual USB charger for the cigarette socket would more or less serve the same purpose in those cases. However, there are enough legacy devices out there that will only work when directly plugged in the cigarette lighter, that this charger really comes in handy.The charger is reasonably well built. It plugs in securely into the lighter socket. The small blue LED light around the USB plug can be handy at night, but it can also be a detraction - those small lights are VERY bright for their size.I have tested this charger while simultaneously using an iPhone and a radar detector. It performed as advertised with both units. I am pretty happy with its function and would recommend it to anyone looking for a similar charger.

    Rating: 5

    2013-09-18: I was provided a Yubi Power USB Car Charger with 12V Cigarette Lighter Socket for testing and review and was asked only to give my honest review, so this is what I found.What You Should Know Before You Buy:♦ This thing is a little bulky, but that is to be expected for what it does.♦ It is a cigarette lighter extension that adds a basic phone charger with a single 1.0 Amp USB charging port.♦ It charges very fast (better than 1% charge increase per minute on an iPhone 5).♦ The charger is front heavy. I had a problem maintaining a connection in the horizontal charging outlets in my car.Detailed Review:♦ Look - The product came in a professional looking plastic hanger display package with the car charger displayed in the front and product information on both sides of the inside card. It also had some basic instructions on the back of the card (not that you really need them). This is a larger car charger, but that is to be expected because you are basically extending the cigarette lighter and adding a USB charging port. It has a single 1.0A USB port and a blue LED power indicator light on the front. It appears to have a very nice build quality.♦ Installation - As with any car charger, you basically just plug the unit into you car's charging outlet. Once plugged into a horizontal outlet on my dash (where the charger sticks straight out), I noticed that it would not maintain connection to the charging outlet. It kept coming out enough to stop the charging. I'm not sure if it was due to my car or the fact that it was front heavy due to the larger size. I haven't had any problems with other, smaller car chargers. I moved it to my center console where I have a vertical charging outlet (where the charger stands straight up), and it worked perfectly.♦ Use and Performance - Once installed, I did some basic tests to see how the Yubi Power car charger handles charging up my iPhone 5, while at the same time running the dual screen DVD player in my back seat. During my work commute, I took my iPhone 5 that had 29% charge remaining and I plugged it in. The charger increased the charge on my phone by 31% in about 29 minutes or slightly more than 1% per minute, which is a great result and faster than your average charger. All this while running both DVD player screens at the same time. No reduction in charging speed at all. It worked perfectly and as well as any other higher priced USB chargers that I have used with the added bonus of still having your car's charging outlet available.Conclusion:Overall, this is a good, dual purpose USB Car Charger with a solid build. The unit looks good and performs very well. While you may not be able to use it in horizontal car charging outlets very easy, it works perfectly for vertical applications at a very low price ($8 at the time of this review). If you need to keep your car's charging outlet available, but also want a fast USB charger for your phone, this charger is worth a look.

    Rating: 4

    2013-09-24: If you need to retain your cigarette lighter socket while adding a USB port, this is a simple solution that works extremely well. I tested by charging an Android Galaxy S3 while using a DVD player and it charged just as fast (if not slightly faster) than my existing USB converter. It's a solid unit that's great for the back of the car especially if you have passengers with multiple electronic devices. It's larger than just the USB converter as you would expect and at this price is excellent value for the simple but important task it performs.Disclosure: I received a review sample of this product.
