    2014-04-09: Finding a portable battery capable of meeting Vita's 1.5 A demand for charging purposes can be challenging. Sure, Sony offers their own charger.This little charger, on the other hand, fits the bill quite nicely too. I'm nearly able to get 2x additional full charges out of this for my Vita which means nearly 15 hours of total gameplay (assuming that you were fully charged to begin with). This is pretty handy on long drives where chargeable ports within a vehicle are at a premium when you're competing with cell phones to boot.The indicator is another handy feature. Each tick on the indicator is equivalent to 10% of charge so you can readily tell how much charge you have left on your battery.I've used this handy battery on 3 vacation trips and it has served me well. I'm sure it works well for cell phones, too, but as a PS Vita user, I'm VERY satisfied.

    Rating: 5

    2013-10-18: Product exterior -Main Unit - overall the finish has a great feel to it. A very smooth soft plastic that might show some smudges from skin oils if you look really hard but easy to clean off. It has a good weight to it considering it fits in the hand very comfortably. The ends are very glossy and while the end with the usb ports (input and smart) is perfectly clean, the other side with the imprint saying 'Made in China, model number' was a tiny bit scratched up but nothing really noticeable. It does say over here that input is 1A and output is 2A. Ironically the serial number is not listed on this side at all or on the unit. ****The serial number is actually on a the short charging cable. ***Important, for warranty purposes do not remove this sticker..... I admit that I don't like this because usually any large stickers on cables I usually cut off, and also because the serial number should be on the unit itself rather than just the microusb cable.Microusb Cable - The microusb is a very good quality 1ft charging cable. Some people might prefer longer but fortunately it has the high-quality shielded ends that Samsung OEM Cables have. There is a plastic covering over the ends protecting the finish that you can peel off.Carrying Pouch - an interesting sports-like carrying pouch that is double layered and has a closing elastic mechanism. The microusb cable does fit inside with unit while pouch is closed.Description of use - Very easy to install. I simply connected the microusb input on unit to an Anker 2A USB charger (1A or higher is great). I found it was like 80% charged and it charged up to 100% fairly quickly. It works very simply and great. There is no need for a long charging cable and finding an outlet, this solution works even better and is very portable. I still have not yet tested it on iPhones or the newest Samsung Galaxy Tablets but it does it work perfectly with Galaxy S4 and other Android phones. The unit does not need to be shaken to start charging, it simply starts when plugged in. While charging it does constantly blink the light on and out every second which can get annoying but does at least update its amount of battery left. The white ring is divided up into 10 leds. With unit disconnected simply shaking it shows you the charge level.So far it charges roughly 0.6% per minute on a Galaxy S4. According to 'Galaxy Charging Current' it shows 1900mAh and after a little while drops down to 1200mAh (it does this on stock too). I still need to do more tests though for accuracy and will update later.UPDATE! 2013-10-19 I have now confirmed that it charges at 0.9% per minute on Galaxy S4 at 2A. So it takes between 90 to 120 minutes to fully charge the phone. The last 10% charges more slowly. I did the test from 1% to 93% in about 96 minutes with minimal usage of screen. Also after using a 100% charged Anker 2nd Gen Astro 6000mAh, I unfortunately was left with 40% battery on that unit so enough for almost two charges on a Galaxy S4.Ideal users - I recommend these Portable External Batteries to anyone with a smartphone with non-removable batteries. With an iPhone I'd expect to the user to get 4 Full Charges with this unit. With a Galaxy S4 about 2 Full Charges. I recommend getting a higher capacity if you are going on a bigger trip and need more than 10 full charges without recharging the unit.Overall outstanding item and I'm very impressedI was supplied a sample for test and evaluation, and I promised that my review is fair and honest

    2014-07-01: I've been very pleased with the Anker Portable battery. It's small enough to easily carry in a pocket or bag, and so far I have been able to fully charge my iPhone 4s twice on one charge. My only complaint would be that you must use your own phone cable with the USB plug to attach your phone to the battery.     Rating: 4

    2014-02-08: Used to be when I'd travel by plane, I'd bring a book, a stack of magazines, a large bottle of water and of course, I able to wear shoes with laces. Obviously, there's a new world order and traveling means I have to stay in touch with everyone at all times! Besides hauling my Mac Book, I now bring my iPhone, iPad, slide on shoes and because of TSA restrictions, no water bottle.I'm not phased by dehydration. Like most travelers, my fear of all fears, is that my electronics will lose their power, while in midair! I get the shakes at being left with no phone to tell my family, friends and colleagues that I'm waiting on a line or bored. I also shudder at having no books, magazines or emails from work to read. After all, without any power, I am a broken man - dehydrated, staring at my slip ons.I'd heard that external batteries were an option but thought they were expensive, bulky and not dependable. After hearing my son Alex rave about his battery pack, I decided to read some independent reviews and take a cyber stroll to Amazon. Review after review highlighted Anker's superb quality, reliability and features. However, my foremost reason for going with Anker was their excellent customer service. I noticed that if in fact there was a negative review, Anker remedied each and every malady. As a result of my research, I decided to order the Anker, 2nd Gen Astro, 6000mAh Portable Charger (2A Output) for $29.99, at Amazon.Looks: In about two days, I received the Anker, 2nd Gen Astro and the biggest surprise was how small the battery was. While I knew this model was portable, I had no idea it would be smaller and lighter than my iPhone 5. Another feature was the black matte rubber finish which is both good looking and felt solid in my hand. The Anker also came with a handsome padded, nylon-stretchy pouch. The Anker fits nicely in either my briefcase or jacket pocket.Performance: The Anker comes with a micro USB cable and can be charged, via your computer or with a number of plugs that accommodate a USB cord. The only exception was my iPhone charger. For some odd reason, when I used my iPhone charger, the Anker's light would flash wildly and not take a charge. However, when I used my other electric charger (Non-Apple), the Anker charged beautifully. Out of the box, the Anker came charged and filled up in about twenty. When completely empty, the Anker charged in about three hours, even though the instructions stated six hours. An LED circle light alerts you to the existing power levels and turns off, when charging is complete. Once charged, the Anker goes into sleep mode and can be turned on with a slight shake. With the Anker fully charged, I went on a tear, charging almost anything in sight! I charged my iPhone 5 (With 9% power remaining), Garmin 410 Forerunner GPS Watch (30% power remaining), iPod Nano (Empty), iPod Shuffle (Couldn't determine the remaining power) and iPad Mini with Retina Display (8% power remaining). The Anker charged up the iPhone, iPod Namo and Garmin 410 without a hitch and each, in about an hour and a half. The only problem was with the iPod Shuffle. For some odd reason, I seem to believe there are some cable compatibility issues with the shuffle. As for my iPad Mini, the Anker finally ran out of juice. I would like to add that the charging times are approximations and were not scientifically timed. In my opinion, the charging times were impressive.Regrets: I have to admit, I wholeheartedly recommend the Anker, 2nd Gen Astro, 6000mAh Portable Charger (2A Output). The charger is inexpensive, good looking, portable, easy to use and will charge your phone, as well as most portable electronics. My only regret is that I didn't purchase the more powerful Anker 2nd Gen Astro2 9000mAh Portable Power Bank Backup External Battery Charger Rapid-Recharge (3A Output) Dual-Port. This bad boy can charge any two electronic devices and only costs $36.99!

    2014-01-24: I have to say, I was thoroughly impressed at under $30. A friend let me use their mophie portable battery on the road and I thought that it was a cool product. And then I looked the mophie up and decided that for $100 I'd rather buy and keep an entire spare cellphone on me.I've purchased Anker's replacement laptop batteries before so I figured I would try their portable battery out. The shake to charge feature is very cool, it beats fiddling with buttons on other packs, and I've noticed that simply plugging a device into this will be enough to initiate a charge if your battery isn't already dead. The soft touch finish makes this feel like you paid a lot more than $30 for it, and it comes with a carrying case as well as a microUSB cable.I charge it up using a 2.1A tablet charger, and then it's good for charging my phone fully almost three times. It charged my HTC at "A/C" speed according to the Status menu on the phone, which is a good thing. Not a bad deal at all, and even better when you consider they're using Samsung or similarly high quality battery cells in the device. It's not very large, and fits easily into a camera bag or backpack; if you have more space to spare, you might want to consider their 9000 mAh or larger chargers, they add more capacity and more ports!

    Rating: 5

    2013-10-18: The second generation Astro 6000 mAh is a compact and useful little gadget that is solidly build with a very minimalistic design. All the while, this sleek, 7 ounce battery will fit into your pocket effortlessly. The soft rubber-like material makes gripping the device a breeze. The separate LED indicator lights also provides a more precise telling of the remaining battery power of the unit itself, which fades seamlessly beneath the surface of the battery pack when the unit is in an off state. All available ports are placed on one end of the device, which includes a 5V/1A micro-USB input, as well as a 5V/2A (max) standard USB output charge port that is compatible with an assortment of USB-chargeable electronics.When testing the Astro on its functionality, I connected my iPhone 5S (as well as an assortment of other devices later on) to the battery device with the appropriate charge cable. To activate the battery and let the charging begin, I simply had to shake the battery to activate its charging capability. No buttons necessary.Charging my phone from 10% to full took around an hour or so. I was able to get two charges for my phone from a fully charged battery pack. This is with the phone on, connected, and with apps running in the background.A standard micro-USB was also provided for those who have Android or other compatible devices. No Apple charge cable or adapters were provided, but the original Lightning cable that came with my phone worked just fine.Items in the box includes:-Astro 6000- Instruction manual- A stout micro-USB charge cableFeatures:-6000 mAh battery capacity-Single USB port that detects the connected device and smartly outputs the specific charge rate to ensure there's no overcharging or overheating issues-No AC wall charger was provided with this unit, but it is compatible and will recharge with any standard USB wall charger, including my Apple wall charger-18 month warrantyFor reference, here are some common devices and the amount of mAh of capacity they have when they are fully charged:* iPhone 5 battery 1440 mAh battery capacity* iPhone 5S battery 1560 mAh battery capacity* iPad 2 battery 6,944 mAh battery capacity* iPad 3 battery 11,560 mAh battery capacity* iPad 4th (gen.) battery is 11,486 mAh 3.7 VDC at 42.5 Wh* iPad Mini battery is 4490 mAh at 3.72 VDC 16.7 WhAs noted, you will not be able to fully charge the latest Apple iPad with the Retina display, as this is only a 6000 mAh capacity battery. You must also consider the losses in the charging circuits of both the battery and the device you are charging. When using an external battery, one must take the heat transfer, voltage conversion, and the electronics of your device's charging circuits into consideration. Other contributing factors include running background apps on your smartphone/tablet, as well as its connectivity to Wi-Fi or the LTE networkReal world examples of charging capability with this battery pack:* iPhone 5S approximately 200% of full charges* iPad 2 approximately 57.5% of a full charge* iPad 3 or 4 approximately 34% of a full charge* iPad Mini approximately 80% of a full chargeThis product is solid, functional, and well-designed. I rate it at 5 stars and will encourage anyone who is always on the go and have to depend on their tablet/smartphone for long periods of time to give this product a try.I was provided a product free of charge in order to provide an honest review

    Rating: 5

    Rating: 5

    2013-10-17: After rolling out new 2nd generation versions of Astro 3 (3 outputs) and Astro 2 (2 outputs), now is a turn for Astro with a single charging output. While Astro 3 was very impressive with three outputs and 12000 mAh capacity, it was a relatively large and heavy device, which is expected. Astro 2 shrunk it down to 2 outputs and 9000 mAh capacity with a more pocket friendly footprint. Here with single output Astro and 6000 mAh capacity the size was reduced down to an awesome compact size which you can store even inside of a very small purse. But don't let the small size fool you - you still get all new 2nd gen design with every bell'n'whistle of Astro 2 and 3. So let's take a closer look.Continuing with their environmentally friendly packaging, battery came inside of a neatly packaged box which contained a battery itself, a manual (always very detailed), and accessory box with usb to micro-usb cable and a mesh draw-string storage bag for a battery and a cable. Now let me tell you about the size of this battery - its is SMALL!!! Weighting around 130g and with a size of 90mm by 45mm and thickness of 25mm - it will easily fit in a palm of your hand where you can make a fist hiding it inside. That's how compact it is. With a new rounded design and smooth edges, the hard plastic shell is lined with a soft touch rubbery finish. You get one micro-usb battery charging port (1A speed to charge the battery itself) and one full usb smart output port for any Android or Apple device. The output supports a maximum charging speed of up to 2A. In my quick test with OEM usb cable I confirmed a charging speed of 1.5A using my Note 2. The speed will obviously vary depending on the cable you use, so keep that in mind and use usb cables with thicker wires.Just like with Astro 2 and 3, this 2nd gen device uses a new 10-segment circle LED indicator to show you the charging progress of the battery or the remaining charge on the battery in increments of 10% thus giving you a higher precision reading. Most of the other batteries usually include 4 LEDs to indicate 25% increments, but with Astro you are getting a better precision. There is no power button anywhere around smooth surface of this battery. To start the charging or to check the remaining capacity you just shake it and display LED comes alive. Also, considering actual capacity of any external battery is typically 30% less then advertised value, in case of 2nd gen Astro a more efficient conversion circuit is used which gives close to 80% efficiency, so you can count on about 4700-4800 mAh of charging power. Considering super compact shape of this battery, this is very impressive and perfect as a portable emergency charge you can take with you anywhere.Overall, the design, the efficiency, the charging speed, and compact size of this battery makes it a very attractive package. It is also very unique and sets it apart from competition. Add to that Anker's 18-month warranty and great support - with introductory price of $29.99 on Amazon this is one fantastic value. I highly recommend it!

    Rating: 5

    2014-05-29: Handsome and well made charging device. Very easy to use. Charges my HTC One M8 in 2 hours. Highly recommended.

    Rating: 5

    2014-04-21: I purchased this external battery about two months ago. Has enough power to charge two phones and the charge indicator shows the charge level of the battery which is helpful. Battery is small enough to put in pocket, backpack or purse and the matte finish feels good to the hand. This is a quality product, very satisfied with purchase.

    Rating: 5

    2014-06-18: This is fantastic product. It charges my phone at least 2 times, or may be 3, before running out, and it also has long standby time. It comes with nice pouch and easy to carry.

    Rating: 4

    2014-04-23: technical specs sound good. great design/packaging, and auto charge feature helps identify the equip on charge. but the product stopped working in 2 months - batteries were drained and would not recharge. filed a compliant and no response yet. Moms gift gone wasted.

    Rating: 1

    2014-02-01: Convenient form factor. I did not notice battery actually discharged a bit after is for driven in a car full day (and the light was on all the time because of car vibration). So motion sensor does not seem to be an issue like others fear.It's capacity is as or better than described by Anker. My Nexus 5 does get three full charges out of it - provided it is turned OFF while charging.How fast it charges itself really depends on the power source - as expected. Feels reasonably fast - but I never measured.

    Rating: 5

    2014-07-05: I looked at a lot of chargers before deciding on this one. This is compact and lightweight. I bought the black one. Has a good quality feel about it. Smart device can charge at up to 2A. No buttons. Has a small circle of ten LEDs to show charge level. A light shake wakes up device to show level. It also starts device to charging. It seems to wake up when I connect it to what I want to charge without shaking.The case has a nice soft feel to it. It comes with a USB cable and a mesh carry pouch.The LEDs fade on/off when it is charging something. While it is being charged they stay on with the ring of lights completing to show state of charge.I'm happy with my choice.

    Rating: 5

    2014-05-17: I got the Yellow 2nd Gen Astro 6000mAh battery to keep in my car for backup and road trips. I don't consider myself a heavy user but I sometimes do have to spend a lot of time on my phone and it drains the battery. This is good to keep as a backup in case I needed some extra juice. It's nice bright yellow color makes it easy to spot in the dark and the LED indicator is helpful to tell how much of a charge is left and makes it a bit easier to spot too.Packaging and shipping - 5 Stars* Fast shipping* Minimalistic and recycled green packingIncludes:* The Anker 2nd Gen Astro 6000 mAh battery* The battery pack comes with an instruction manual.* A USB charging cable that is 12 inches long.* Customer Service bookletAnker 2nd Gen Astro 6000 mAh External Battery Pack Features - 5 Stars* Powerful and long lasting 6000 mAh capacity* The unit is compact and weighs in at 4.75 ounces.* Attractive design with a Yellow smooth external coating. The yellow smooth coating is slightly matte so it is easy to grip.* Not a finger print magnet, keeps very clean.* Very easy to spot and not miss* The specifications and ports are nicely labeled on the case.* It has 10 LED status lights in a ring located on the front that indicates the battery charge level. You have to shake the battery and the LED ring will light up and indicate the battery charge level. Each LED represents 10% of capacity.* This is an ideal size and power of battery to carry in a purse, briefcase or backpack for your smart phone!* There is one USB power output. It is a USB port rated at 5 VDC and 2 Amps* it is a smart power IQ USB port the uses only the current required by your device to properly charge it as quickly as possible.* When you plug in a device then the charging process of your device begins automatically.* Should count down with the LED until the charging is finished when the LED is steady.* The battery pack uses Lithium battery technology.* Superior quality of the battery cells used and the advanced control circuitry within the battery.* You can shake it to tell you how much power is left in the battery pack* The battery pack can be recharged over 500 times* Warranty is 18 months and customer service is great* The battery pack does not come with an AC wall charger. It is needs to be charged with 5 VDC at 1 amp. It will charge in about 5 hours at 1 Amp input.* The battery is extremely energy efficient and its performance is amazing.This is an amazing Anker product and is in line with what I expect from Anker. Great products with great warranty and customer service. It charges my Nexus 5 a little less than 3 times and my iPhone 5s a little less than 4 times. Amazing product for the price. Good to have one to keep in the car. I would highly recommend as overall this product is a perfect 5 stars!

    Rating: 5

    2014-03-18: This is exactly what I was looking for. I also have the Anker Astro Mini 3000mAh which I love. But this is the same wonderful quality but a perfect size to carry with my iPhone 5s and iPad Mini... Quick recharge, and quick unit charge.

  • B004FM6XU0

    $B004FM6XU0

    2011-10-20: I came across a pretty damaged iPhone and all I needed this part for was to repair was the power button. This part did exactly that, but it was one of the most difficult installations I had ever done on an iPhone. It's not so much that the part is tiny...it's the fact that you have to fold the ribbon cables perfectly and make sure it stays in place while getting everything attached. It also didn't help that I was installing this into a non-OEM back casing. That made the fitting just a little bit off. But that was the case, not this part. In fact, I held this part up to the original and it was almost indistinguishable from the original.The 5-star review is because this product works. It was exactly what I needed and it did it's job just fine. If I were rating this on the easy installation, I'd give it zero stars. But, nobody said it would be easy and for anyone who has ever worked on an iPhone, you know this all too well.

    Rating: 5

    2014-01-01: My original review is below. However, after 1 month the buttons stopped working and after 2 months the audio jack died. I hate to say it, but if you have an IPhone 3GS it's probably cheaper to buy a new Android or Windows phone instead of trying to fix it.I am a podcast junkie, and I was going crazy because just touching the headphone plug caused my iPhone 3GS to cut in and out (or only play in the left or right earbud). Finally, I had no choice but to buy this cable and do the repair. Warning - installing the cable is pretty complicated. If you have no experience repairing your iPhone you might want to use a repair service instead. However, I have poor eyesight and unsteady hands at it took about 2 (frustrating) hours to install this. Also, you need access to Youtube since I doubt this can be done without watching a repair tutorial.Bottom line is that this item FIXED my headphone jack problem and I am extremely happy about that. Unfortunately, the mute button doesn't work. It is possible that this item was defective, but I suspect that I did not get the mute button aligned correctly in the socket (as I said, installing this cable is difficult). Either way, I don't use the mute button, so I give the item 5-stars.

It is now installed (a little less than 3 hours this time!) and appears to be working fine.

    2014-01-01: I have an HTC One. Prior to that I had the Incredible 2. It has worked well for me for both phones in either landscape or portrait position. At this price, why not? Keep one at each desk, or car, etc. I have not had a problem using it at all even with the protective cases on the phones. My phones have never toppled over either. The stand seems steady enough but the HTC is much thinner than any of the the iPhones, and the cases I buy are also thin.I only deduct one star because it is made in and shipped from China, and I'd rather buy local, but as far as how it works, cannot complain at all.

    2012-04-12: The designer deserves an award. So I increased the ridge's height with tape and now the phones do stay up but what a non-professional sight. I hope that the merchant's next order to their manufacturer will correct this unfortunate glitch.

  • B005OTKTMQ

    $B005OTKTMQ

    2012-08-30: Over the years, I have amassed quite a pile of gadgets with screens, and every one of them is protected with a Skinomi TechSkin. I love their product, and find it much easier to install and use than Zagg's version. However, this one left me somewhat dissatisfied. The protector went on easily enough, but once it dried, it left visible lines and dots over the screen of my Galaxy Nexus. These do not go away with further smoothing, or over time, as I've experienced in the past. I followed the directions to a tee, and there is nothing (dust, etc.) under the protector. It just doesn't work with this screen for some reason. The lines and dots appear to be in the actual TechSkin, rather than on the phone, or in between the two layers. It's like looking through old glass that has begun to run.

    Rating: 3

    2011-12-12: Follow the installation directions exactly as stated. Get your fingers wet, screen wet and the screen protector wet. Make sure you don't push the excess solution in to the phone earpiece and apply by aligning the holes first from the top. Allow 24 hours to dry and get rid of the bubbles.The bad part is that this screen protector is slightly off by 0.5 mm in length. I made sure to normalize the temperature and apply it in room temperature conditions.

If not, it takes longer for it to set3. It took mine about 3 days for it to become crystal clear (most likely because I didn't squeegee as well as i should have4.     2012-09-22: OK, so I wanted the max protection for my new Google Galaxy Nexus so I went out and spent $30 on the Xgear Fantom which is actually a piece of thin glass! I liked the Fantom but 3 weeks later the adhesive began to fail and the Fantom glass started pulling away from the phone glass, so I sent it back for a refund. I went over to the XDA forums and saw that they had a poll going for favorite screen protector and the Skinomi rated pretty highly so for $9 I decided to try it. Wow! All I can say is wow.. it's a wet application, meaning you spray both sides with an included detergent solution and apply it wet. Skinomi provides a very nice hard rubber piece to use to smooth it out, much much better than using a creditcard as other manufacturers would have you do. I applied it, smoothed it out and wiped the excess solution and then let it sit under a small fan for about 12-14 hours. when i came back, it was like glass, almost perfect, you could barely tell that it's there and my screen responsiveness is as good or better than it was! Highly recommend, especially over the cheaper no-name brands available on ebay.

    Rating: 5

    2012-09-29: Before I say anything about this item, I'll say this WATCH THE VIDEO of this being installed or you'll be wasting your 10 bucks. Application is not as smooth as other screen protectors but with good reason the end result is better that any I've used in the past. I was a little worried because of the wet application but it went fine again FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS. Usually if I spend this much for a screen protector I'm looking for a 3 pack but with a lifetime warranty there is nothing to worry about in the future.

    Rating: 4

    2012-05-11: I messed up the installation and had to ask for another one. It should come with more films. Customer service was perect!

    Rating: 4

    2012-01-04: I put this protector on my Galaxy Nexus. I carefully followed directions, saturated my fingers with the provided solution, and wet the back of the protector (not excessively). I applied the protector to the phone, slide it into place and then sqeegeed out the fluid and bubbles from the center out to the edges while quickly dabbing the excess fluid with a paper towel. I then let the phone sit for 24 hours before powering up.The good:- the protector covers the entire glass surface and thus affords maximum protection to the screen;- 99% of the bubbles and imperfections just squeegeed out, the balance disappeared after 24 hours; and- the cost of this protector is very good in comparison to the competition.The bad:- installation is more complicated than experienced with the typical dry application protector;- I had some fear that the excess solution I squeegeed out from under the protector had found its way into the phone's guts and shorted out my new expensive toy. It hadn't, thankfully, but water and electronics don't mix well so there is some risk in using a product like this;- the protector never became "crystal" clear like a typical dry protector. Rather, it had a wavey look to it under certain light conditions;- worst of all, when I reinstalled my gell case, the edges of the case lifted the edges of the protector and ruined the effect and utility of the product. That's not the fault of the Skinomi product, but is an issue that you need to consider when deciding on the the kind of protector that you want on your screen and the case that you use to protect the rest of the phone. The dry application protectors that I bought from Verizon don't cover the entire screen and thus don't have this problem because the edge of the gell case rests against the glass, not the protector. So, depending on the kind of case that you have, this protector may not be your best bet. The irony here is that a major advantage offered by this protector of covering the entire glass surface turned out to be its undoing; and- finally, surrendering my phone for 24 hours while the solution dried was a tough sacrifice to make.Frankly, I don't see that the good outweighs the bad. The clear protectors sold by Verizon go on in 2 minutes with no bubbles or imperfections (if applied properly), provide adequate protection, work well with gell cases that wrap around the edge of the glass, are crystal clear, and require no down time. They may cost a few bucks more, but their cost is insignificant in comparison to the value of the device. I'm not aware of any claim made by the manufacturer that these protectors offer superior protection to the dry application protectors (aside from covering the entire screen). So then, why bother?

    Rating: 3

    2012-08-10: This product for me works flawlessly, for the half price against the famous brand. First you need to be patient in installing this, damp some liquid to your hand an secondly make sure you damp the screen protector with liquid before installing, tap the screen protector on your wet hands to take out the excess liquid, align then used the rubber to even the bubbles and wipe the edges with the cloth that comes with it, before everything though turn it off. And one more thing wet the rubber thing for eveningthe screen, after put it down facing the screen down on a think tissue so that it'll absorbed all the excess liquids, after an hour try blowdrying on a low setting and leave it overnight on the tissue facing down. Get it:-)

    Rating: 5

This is definitely the nicest screen protector I've ever used but I will probably try a cheaper option next time.

    2012-02-09: In the past, I've used these screen protectors for 4 smartphones. I have always loved the quality and they last virtually forever. They are a pain in the rear to install and the consumer is constantly worried about using water on a phone. After waiting 24-48 hours for the product to dry it is well worth it, normally. This time, like once before (samsung vibrant) the screen protector didnt release the microbubbles properly. I have an unsigtly orange peel effect on the majority of the screen. In all fairness, the screen has a slight curviture and i think that is why the squegee created a slight crease in the middle of the screen. With a product like this, it is hit or miss ususally due to user error. This screen protector covers edge to edge and doesnt allow use for a case. I have used a case on this phone and the screen protector peels off around the edges.     Rating: 3

    2013-08-19: I got one of these shields to last me eighteen months of hard use and in-pocket stowage before it even BEGAN to show signs of wear. It went on easily, without bubbles or gaps anywhere on the screen [this is not generally the case with these membranes, especially the ones that go on dry]. Buy it. You'll love it.

    Rating: 5

    2012-04-10: The screen protector was hard to install (I still have an eyelash stuck under it). I removed and reapplied it, probably 4 times and used up the applicator spray that shipped with it.After installed, I notice there are tiny "grooves" or gouges in the screen protector from when I accidentally swiped with the side of my finger and caught the protector with my fingernail. When the screen is on, these grooves aren't noticeable, only when the screen is off and when you look at it from an angle. Another way to put it is the screen has an "orange peel" effect now that I have this protector on it. The screen protector also feels softer and adds a bit of resistance when swiping.As far as clarity, when the screen is on, I barely notice the screen protector. I've kept my phone in the same pocket as my keys and the screen still looks good as new.Even though I have more negative comments than positive in this review, I still think this is worth 4 stars because Skinomi is better than the alternatives. I plan on getting a Skinomi for all of my devices (and then cursing the installation but enjoying the protection afterwards).

    Rating: 4

    2012-11-27: The most impressive part of this skin was the packaging. It was over the top. and unneeded.As for the screen protector it is applied wet (you spray your screen with a liquid then apply) you must then wait for it to dry. I did this as directed and found a lot of bubbles, they do slowly go away after a couple of days but one larder bubble (maybe 1/8" by 1/16") never went away. I cannot say if this was the screens fault or mine but I'll assume mine.The screen, like all others I have tried, did make the screen look a little less sharp. But it did protect the screen from scratching and did fir the phone very well.I was happy with the protector. I have since put a zagg invisi shield on my phone. It is applied by a tech in the mall, cost $20 and they will replace it as long as I have the material. I made the change because they put the screen protector on for me and boy were they good at it.Comparing them both the materials are very similar and both provide the required protection.

    Rating: 4

    2012-01-25: I ordered this Skinomi for my Galaxy Nexus within days of buying the phone, and I ordered the phone the day it came out back in December. I was amazed that Skinomi already had a skin for my phone.I am very familiar with Skinomi skins as I had one on my last 2 phones and I have recommended (and installed) them on many phones for friends and family.It is important to know that many people who claim that a skin has bubbles under the skin is because they didnt follow proper directions. There is no possible way that a bubble that appears under a skin can be the fault of the skin itself, it is always, 100% of the time the fault of the installer.If you follow the directions on these skins properly, you will have a perfectly fitting skin every time. Keep in mind that some bubbles immediately after installation are normal and they WILL work themselves out. Cheaper, hard plastic skins wont do this. If there is any bubble after you are done, it will always remain there.Some people criticise Skinomi's because they give your screen a textured look after its done. They show fingernail presses for quite a while after they're installed. That is a result of the "gel-like" material that the Skinomi is made out of and is not a fault with your skin. This look is totally normal, and if you dont like it, don't blame the skin, you just have a preference that differs from how this skin is designed to work.All skins should be a tad bit (1-2mm) smaller than the actual screen of your phone. If every skin went perfectly to the razors edge of your screen, it would get snagged easily and would start peeling. I see reviews of people saying the skin is too small. This is also intentional and is not a defect (unless of course the gap is more than 2mm).The Skinomi skin is as good of a skin as you can buy, for a fraction of the price. If you follow the directions, or have someone who is experienced in installing skins on a phone do it for you, you will be happy with the results and this skin should last you for the life of your phone. You wont have to keep replacing it like you have to with other cheap skins.Finally, there is one thing you should be aware of, that has bitten me once on a prior phone. Because of the gel-like nature of the Skinomi skin, the screen can become slightly "tacky" when it gets warm. So if you are in the habit of keeping your phone inside your pockets, your body heat may cause the screen to become ever so slightly tacky. If you also keep money or other pieces of paper in that same pocket, the paper can become stuck to the screen if you leave it in there too long. It will come off, but it may leave a residue behind that will last for a couple of days. This is probably the only flaw I can possibly think of with these skins, but again, its due to how they're made, and I dont think that this should detract from all of the other great qualities of this product.HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!

    Rating: 5

    2013-11-14: Love this screen protector! Couldn't find anything to fit correctly on the curved screen, this new technique did the trick. Applied easily and stayed on for months, removed when I sold the phone. Looking for a similar product for my Nexus 5 now.

    Rating: 5

    2013-01-18: the go on very nicely, the fit great. i would not go back to the very spendy mall brands. these are a great product.

    Rating: 5

    2012-01-31: I spent a lot of time on the net and on Amazon searching for a screen protector for my Galaxy Nexus. I will completely admit that I hate screen protectors and in my experience, they never last, diminish screen clarity, are overpriced, difficult to install properly, and leave me more frustrated than thankful when owning one. That was until I got my hands on this protector. This review is a description of my personal experience but I used many tips and tricks from other reviewers here on Amazon when I bought my protector. I am not trying to steal from their reviews, I am simply describing my experience which involved their tips and tricks.This screen protector goes on wet. I am a lint and bubble making pro in most cases when it comes to applying these screen protectors so,'wet' seemed like the way to go. The wet application of this one makes it almost impossible to screw it up but you need to follow some basic tips.1. Before you even open the box, you should go to YouTube and watched the installation video at least once. I did this before I even bought it. It is only 5 minutes and worth it.2. Make a special time to install your protector. I know, this sounds silly but from other remarks and reviews I read, it seems that some people mess these up when they handle their phones too soon. I started by forwarding my calls to another phone and then I pulled the battery out of my device to prevent accidental powering on. I chose a Friday night for installation because I sleep in a bit on Saturdays and I wanted to ensure the maximum amount of time to settle and dry. Then, make sure you have a clean work area free and clean hands.3. When applying the film, use a lot of the spray. With the battery pulled out of the phone, the non-conductive spray won't hurt the speaker or anything it comes in contact with and it dries without damaging any electronics. Use plenty of spray on your hands, the device, and the film. This makes it easier to install and set up straight. Of all things to think of during the installation, getting it straight is the most important thing!4. I chose to not use the squeegee wedge thing. Unfortunately, this squeegee card has rough edges to it and there are some sharp little bits on there that have been reported to scratch the film. Alternatives you may think of are: a rubber squeegee, rubber spatulas, a driver's license, business cards, or anything non metallic that would make a good squeegie. Windshield wiper? I actually just used my lint free cloth to "rub" the moisture out.5. Once applied, be prepared for the protector to look like poo! Seriously. Just make sure it is straight. When I applied mine, I thought it looked horrible. I remembered reading that it would have some bubbles but they dissapear after a few days. Mine looked like there was "fizz" underneath. To my dismay, the fizz congregated by the next morning and formed half a dozen air pockets (aka, bubbles). I was pretty irked but remembered what I read, it will go away. After another day, they were all gone. Amazing! Be patient, once you are past the initial installation, do not try to re-do it or get rid of the bubbles, they will go away!This protector has proven to be the clearest film I have ever seen. Yes, there is a small amount of orange peel, but that is intentionally there by design and does not affect the viewing of your device. The film is self-healing and will get some bumps and dents and whatnot in it over time. These imperfections cannot be seen from the viewing angle and they "heal" over time. If you happen to encounter a "permanent" wound to your skin, it is backed by a lifetime warranty and Skinomi will send you a brand new skin (sans shipping) in exchange for your damaged one. In other words, you get a lifetime worth of screen protectors.I would reccomend this protector to anyone that asks and I am extremely impressed with both it's clartiy as well as it's quality. Given the warranty, it appears I have paid for my last skin for at least the next two years.

    Rating: 5

    2012-09-15: This is the third wet screen protector that I have tried for my phone. The first was an ArmorSuit which was fine but had a tendency to scratch easily. The second was a Zagg which had significant "orange peel" and seemed to decrease the sensitivity of my screen. I got frustrated with the Zagg and decided to try this brand despite the mediocre reviews. I've been using it for a couple of days and here are my impressions:Pros:-Feels more natural and responsive than some of the competition (Zagg and ArmorSuit)-Virtually no "orange peel" effect (not a huge deal but not really desirable)-Covers the entire screen (cutouts for earpiece, sensors, and camera)-Small bubbles went away quickly and completely-Includes everything you need, including a microfiber cloth and squeegee card-Instructions direct you to an installation video for ultimate clarificationCons:-None really, I guess all these wet screen protectors could stand to be a few bucks cheaperOverall I am very happy with this screen protector. It was no easier or harder to install than the competition, has no "orange peel" effect, feels less evident in everyday use, and the screen remains responsive. No comments yet on long term durability but I'm sure it will be fine. Give this product a try is you are dissatisfied with your current screen protector.

    Rating: 5

    2012-11-27: Had it on in minutes. Easy to put on and works perfectly. Didn't have any issues with the wet application and found it easier to adjust than dry.

    Rating: 5

    2011-12-29: This is my second Skinomi skin, and I must say I'm pleased with this one even more than the first.Pros:- The packaging is top notch, and the kit comes with everything you need for a perfect install.- The skin is very clear and slick- The microfiber cleaning cloth the kit comes with it great- Their customer service has been great every time I've contacted themCons:- The squeegee it comes with started to come apart as I used it, and left hair scratches on the skin (which will likely fade in a day). I wish they included a hard plastic squeegee instead of the credit card style.Other:- The shipping was astonishingly slow. It took almost three weeks for the skin to arrive. This wasn't Skinomi's fault though, as USPS lost it. The day I notified Skinomi they immediately sent me another skin, no questions asked.- This skin doesn't match the shape of the screen 100% perfectly, but it's as close as every other brand of skin I've applied (Best Skins Ever, Zagg, etc).I just applied the film and it looks great. I'll update the review in a few days once the skin sets fully.

    Rating: 4

    2012-09-21: great screen cover, fits nicely, comes well packaged with everything required to properly apply the screen protector. Perfect fit for the galaxy nexus 4g. holes in the proper location for the camera and sensor.

    Rating: 5

    2012-01-19: After picking up a phone retailing over $800, I figured that a screen protector might be a good idea. After searching out Amazon for the frontrunners, I was a little shocked to find how few were available on a phone that's been out for almost 2 months now. Still, I ended up going with the Skinomi Techskin. I've never used (nor heard of) the brand before, but I have applied decals and racing stripes to numerous cars in the past, so I knew that wet-application techniques were the way to go. That pretty much made the decision for me.I was quite shocked at how smoothly the installation went. If you just follow the instructions on the box it arrives in, you really can't mess it up too badly. The instructions also claimed that micro bubbles would work their way out, but I was extremely shocked at how all of the larger bubbles I couldn't squeegee out managed to disappear. Within 24 hours the protector was flawless! The only marks that I could very very lightly see would be a few crease markers where I pressed down too hard when squeegeeing the application fluid out.A few minor notes on installation for those who haven't ever did this before. First off, do it in your bathroom. Close the door, steam up the entire room to an almost uncomfortable level, and do not open the door or turn on a fan. This creates an almost perfectly dust-free environment, as dust will be attracted to the steam, and very little will be left in the air. Wait until the steam settles and move on. Second, DO NOT FORGET TO APPLY APPLICATION FLUID TO THE FRONT AS WELL. This step is extremely important if you want to be able to squeegee the screen down without creasing and scratching the crap out of the front of the protector. I had to reapply application fluid to the front at least 4-5 times as I continued to squeegee every last bubble out I could see. If you're afraid of spraying the fluid directly on your phone, just spray it on your finger and rub the fluid on the front manually...works just as well. Just make sure you don't apply too much pressure on a dry area of the screen or you may crease it.That brings me to my next point. Yes, the protector is just a little bit softer than others I've used, and if you drug a key across it, you probably would have to buy another one...as it does imprint if pressed rather hard with a sharp object. HOWEVER, I must stress that the screen would be completely protected, and I wouldn't doubt that ability of this protector to actually keep anything from completely cutting through to the screen. That is NOT something I could say about other protectors I've had in the past...even protectors who's surface feels harder. Lastly, I haven't noticed any "rainbow effect" that others have complained of, but who knows...it may be similar to how certain people can see the rainbow effect on a DLP projector/screen and most others can't.Anyhow, quick pros and cons summary for prospect buyers out there:Pros:Wet ApplicationExcellent bubble-removalProtects the actual screen admirablyEasy InstructionsLooks Great when finishedCons:Scratch/crease/impression proneCost more then many othersAs you can see, I have no real problems with this protector. Yes, it may cost a little more then many others out there, but are people really going to complain about spending a few dollars more on something that will protect an $800 investment? Me personally, this isn't something I would skimp on. For only $6 to $8, it's a no-lose situation as far as I'm concerned. I'll update my review if I notice any problems that's arise.EDIT - 1/21/11 - I've dropped down from 5 stars to 4 stars due to so many imprints starting to form on the surface of the protector. While the screen does continue to retain it's smooth feel, I've noticed that its starting to feel a little more rubbery, and when pinching to zoom its easy to accidently dig a fingernail into it, thus creating a permanent crease. While these imperfections are very superficial and on the surface, they still are making the protector look slightly less appealing. Perhaps a little bit tougher 1st layer might not have been all that bad of an idea afterall.

    Rating: 4

    2012-06-12: Need some careful to glue, because of the wet way of fixing. Search for some videos showing how to do it. But its very smooth sliding once applied. Does not hold your fingers to slide. The fingers marks could be improved. I lot of dirty after some use. But its ok overall.

    Rating: 3

    2012-01-26: It seemed great when i first put it on, but soon after developed many ripples and causes more glare making it difficult to see the screen some times. I would not buy this product again.

  • B00IX1FLOS

    $B00IX1FLOS

    2014-05-23: The Aduro U-GRIP is a nicely designed mount for phones and navigation systems.The U-GRIP is nicely made with quality plastics and is well assembled. The arms that hold your device in place have soft rubber on the inside to protect what they are holding. The suction cup has a sticky residue on it that makes mounting it to a windshield effortless. Once mounted you flip a switch to activate the vacuum on the suction cup, and it holds very strongly. I removed the mount from my windshield after a few hours and no residue was left behind, but I would not recommend leaving it mounted in a hot car for days since the plastic of the suction cup may deform.The U-GRIP held my iPhone in place tightly and I was able to use the screen without much problem, however the arms that grip the device make it a bit hard to use the screen right beside them. The ball and socket joint allows you to move the mount in almost any direction so you can make sure the device is pointing where you want. You can adjust the width of the mount, and the largest width should accommodate even the largest phone, but some oversized navigation units will probably not fit.All in all... a secure grip that doesn't harm your device.(I received a complimentary sample of this product from the manufacturer in exchange for an unbiased review.)

    Rating: 4

    2014-04-06: This mount has some pluses and minuses. First the pluses:>> The overall build quality is good. It’s all plastic, but it feels pretty substantial. The ball and socket joint moves smoothly and allows for a good adjustment range.>> The suction cup worked well. As with any suction cup, you need to have a clean, smooth surface for best results. Wetting the base of the cup with a little water also helps it maintain a good hold. I didn’t have any problems with it staying stuck even when going over bumps. Same with touching the screen, even with a decent amount of force.>> The arms have padding that help it grip the phone plus avoid scratching the case. Grip strength is good. You can rotate the position from portrait to landscape.But the minuses are pretty significant:>> Adjusting the arms requires you to push in the locking buttons which moves the arm through three stop points. The buttons are small and hard to push. This is not a mount for those with limited hand strength or arthritis. And, even if you have good hand strength, you end up pinching your finger when you push the buttons and pull up.>> There are only three pre-set stop points for the arm. When I put in my phone (Samsung Galaxy) without its case I was able to find a pre-set the was perfect. However, when I had the phone in the case, one pre-set was a little too tight; the next one was too loose. The pre-set notches don’t give you the ability to fine-tune the grip distance.>> The top grip is spring loaded, but the spring is so firm that when you apply pressure to release it, the arm skips out of the adjustment notch.While it has some merits, a ratchet-type arm adjustment would have been a better design. The three stop adjustment design is limiting and hard to use. It’s workable, but I can’t rate it better than average. Three stars.[Sample provided for review]

    Rating: 3

    2014-04-08: After fully testing this unit in my car and in my home, I am quite impressed with this very well built compact unit! Below I list the PROS and one CON regarding this unit:PROS:+ My HUGE Galaxy 5 player with thick TPU cover (5 inch screen) fit into this tightly, yet securely! My HUGE Samsung Galaxy Grand Duos fit into this even with it's semi thick cover on it! (This needs to be FULLY adjusted and to the largest adjustment by holding down the buttons on the left (both) and pulling out the adjustment section).+ Smaller devices fit well into this adjusting the buttons.+ On the left side of the phone holding part is the clip, you just pull up on the clip to release the phone or GPS.+ The adjustment goes back to the smallest adjustment once you remove say a large device (5 inch screen type).+ This comes with: Extra sticky pad to attach to the bottom of this should you need it. This is a SUPER SUPER sticky pad that you can place on your dash or any area where you need more sticky area and more secure holding power! (For places in your car or home that you need extra holding power)!!!! (I used this on my dash to as it is more secure there now).+ Easily removes from the dash to use on a tabletop. What I did is I placed my Grand in this and because the Grand is so large, the Grand easily stands up on the table. You can also use the lever to hold it securely down on a countertop in kitchen or bath.+ Small and compact - I keep this in a clear ziplock bag in my purse so I can use this in any car I am driving or use it on a counter, and I have even used it on my nightstand as a phone stand and it works well as a regular stand!CONS:Just one con: I had to push BOTH buttons on the right side in adjustments to be able to fit my large phone in this. No problem, I am used to this now!!Provided by Aduro. Happy to recommend this to all!

    Rating: 5

    2014-04-15: I'm talking about the sticky plastic that works as a suction cup and holds this gadget firmly to your dashboard. I first saw and used this type of sticky plastic with a set of lint rollers: When the roller filled up with lint, all you had to do was run it under water from the faucet and the "sticky" loses it stickiness and the lint washes off. After the plastic dries, the stickiness comes back--good as new. I think it is a great idea to use it on a suction cup--and it works!I struggled at first, playing around with this mount, trying to get a grip on the slider part. The trick is to remove the gripper part from the base mount so your fingers have a wider range in which to move and manipulate the slider adjustment buttons. That is simple to do with a few turns of the plastic screw nut. Then you just pull the gripper section off the ball joint on the base. Then it is easy-peasy to make adjustments to fit your phone.I disagree with the claim that you can mount your phone into this holder single-handed. No, definitely not: The clamp is really tight and you should not fight with it while you are driving. Set it up before you put the car in gear!The suction plastic is very sticky, which might limit where you can use this: If you have a tough, thick vinyl dashboard, you should be okay. If you use it on a thinner material with some give (like leather or wood veneer) you may stretch the material when you try to remove it, or the sticky might rip off some slivers of veneer. Same might happen with a painted surface.*I received a sample product from Entronik for Aduro.

    Rating: 4

    2014-04-22: I like the flexibility of the U-Grip Slide. The main arm is adjustable to hold mobile devices of various sizes. The adjustment arm uses squeeze clips, which prevent the arm from going outward, but will bump down to the lower catch if the spring clip is pressed down. I've come to push my device upward toward the spring clip, and then swing the bottom out of the grip, so I never need to worry about readjustment.The grip rotates to any orientation I prefer. I chose the blue grip, and the color looks nice, on the interior and exterior of the grip. This dashboard mount uses a strong suction mechanism that holds really well, and it includes a disc of 3M adhesive that would come in handy for an older, weathered dash, if needed. There is a little rubber cup surface with a donut edge that holds on tight with the press of the latch.Whether on the windshield, or on the dash, the angle of the arm offers flexible mounting options that is quite helpful for keeping map routes handy. This is a great way to keep a pocket free, or a phone safe from scrapes and scratches that may be encountered in a console during travel.This is an excellent mount, at an affordable price. I am completely happy with this accessory, and I would recommend this as a convenient phone mounting option.I was provided with a free sample of this product for evaluation and review.

    Rating: 5

    2014-04-08: I received a review sample and put it to the test. First, please read and heed Comdet's helpful April 6, 2014 review because some of the limitation cited are valid if you have a phone the size of a Samsung Galaxy Note II or larger. For iPhones or phones of similar size this holder does work well.My test with a Samsung Galaxy Note 3 indicates that not only is this a tight fit, but getting the phone into the jaws of the clamp was an exercise in frustration. Like Comdet mentioned, when I had the clamps at the last adjustment stop, opening the spring loaded jaw further to fit the Note 3 would disengage the jaw from the adjustment stop. If you remember what flypaper is, this cycle of events is akin to unsticking that stuff. The more you tried, the more frustrating it is.On the other hand, an iPhone 5S fit the clamp as though they were designed for each other and this product was transformed from a mechanical demon to an absolute joy to use. Among the reasons why it was a joy with the smaller phones are the protective strips on the sides of the clamp (the blue areas in the photos) that ensure your phone will not be marred or scratched. Another reason why I love this for the smaller phones is the suction cup holds strongly, even on the pebble-grained dashboard in my vehicle. And finally, the ability to swivel the phone to just about any conceivable angle adds a lot of convenience. Some holders that I have tested were limited in viewing angle, so this one is a step ahead of that group.Bottom line: if you own a phone the size of a Note II or Note 3, look elsewhere because while this one will work, it's too much trouble in my opinion. If you own a smaller phone this one merits five stars and your consideration.

    Rating: 4

    2013-06-07: These screen guards fit perfectly and are easy to install. I put mine on in about 1 minute with the included squeegee and had only 2 tiny bubbles at the edges of the guard. It does cut down on glare.There are major problems though. The first is that the guard causes a weird "rainbow effect" to appear on the screen. I'm not sure of the science behind it, but I suspect that the anti-glare coating causes light to scatter, which leads to the appearance of red and green spots, especially against white backgrounds. Also, it is very sticky, making it hard to use the swipe-keyboard, or play games that use a swiping motion.If the anti-glare is very important to you, this may be a good purchase, but if you're only interested in scratch protection, buy a regular guard without the anti-glare.

    2013-06-28: I ordered several different cases, one manufactured by Verizon thinking it would be better which was terrible. This Seidio Innocase II Surface Case for my Thunderbolt is perfect.     Rating: 5

    2013-02-21: I like this case so much I've bought two.With my old phone, I went the Otterbox route and definitely recommend their products. The offerings for the Thunderbolt were way too bulky, so I went with Seidio Innocase II- and am glad I did.Pros: Extremely durable with limited added bulk. Cut outs allow adequate access to controls (even improving the ease of hitting the power button.Cons: The case is definitely difficult to open until it loosens up. This is actually a good thing in some ways as I've never worried about the case breaking open, but for battery swappers, this should be a consideration. After a few months of use, this problem goes away.As for why I have purchased two, there is a design flaw: the part of the case between the kickstand and USB port is, by necessity, very thin. After a year and half of use, this strip cracked open. I eventually had to replace the case. Among the options (and given the amount of time I got out of the old one), I thought it was still worth it to go with the Seidio Innocase.

    Rating: 4

    2013-03-18: This is an excellent product. Well made, with a very nice fit, and good protection for phone. A little tricky to get off, but looked up online, and figured it out. Would highly recommend to others.

    Rating: 5

    2011-03-28: This is a great case for the money. The case fits exactly and all of the cutouts are in the correct places. I plan on not dropping my phone, but if I do, I am confident that the case will help protect it from scratches and scuffs. If you are looking for more rugged drop protection, I would suggest a larger case than this.

    Rating: 5

    2011-03-30: I'm not much for cases on my cell phones, but my Thunderbolt is so awesome I figured I should protect it. Problem is that I hate the extra bulk that cases add to phones and the thunderbolt is already a large phone. If you are the same way, this is the case for you. It fits the phone perfectly, is made of strong materials, and feels great. I've tried 3 other cases and this is easily the best one of the bunch. I would recommend this case to anyone.

    Rating: 5

    2011-03-30: This is a sleek and elegant case in a beautiful midnight blue--how fitting for a "thunderbolt" phone! It may be a bit pricey but is well worth the investment towards protection of a high-end phone. I am pleased with this, my first Seidio case, and would not hesitate to purchase more cases made by this company in the future. I just wish they made a similar case for use with the extended battery for this phone, and the same case in a larger variety of colors.Important: this case is VERY difficult to remove. I strongly recommend that you practice putting it on and taking it off because sooner or later you will need to swap batteries or remove the battery for whatever reason, etc., and you will definitely need to know the best way for you to take off the case.

    Rating: 5

    2011-06-07: Decent case, protected my TB from a couple of drops. The first time I put this case on, it took me forever to get it off. At one point I was thinking of using a dremel to cut it off. The trick is wiggle it out, and eventually it comes out. Have had no problems since in taking it out. With the limited number of cases out there for the TB, this is a sure buy. Also note, that this case WILL NOT fit the extended battery option. So that's something to think about.

    2012-08-13: Ok so this product works as advertised. Great having 4 USBs while only using one outlet. However......there is a blue light that emanates from the device when it's plugged in. The light is so bright that it appears as bright if not brighter as the clock numbers on a DVD OR DVR device. So if you plug this in your bedroom and you need darkness to sleep...don't buy or plug it in a different room.

  • B004UDRREK

    $B004UDRREK

    2013-04-27: I was really excited when it came in the mail so I hurried up,and put it on my phone the lights at the bottom off the iPhone case lit up a few times then I went home,and followed all the necessary instructions then plugged it up for as long as it was required for,then I put it on my iPhone 4s and it didn't work I pissed so never again will I purchase another backup battery case that's used lesson learned,I recommend you purchase a brand new one don't buy it used.

    Rating: 1

    2011-12-03: The red color I order receives a LOT of a attention. People tell me if I am holding it in the hallway their eyes track immediately to it. If you have incipio's red feather case, this isn't the same color of red. :) I wasn't expecting it to be exactly the same, but I was hoping it would be close. It is more of a ferrari red, as someone put it, and it is glossy to boot! ;)The case feels like it will be just as slick as the iPhone 4S itself, but if I hold my hand open with the case and phone in it... and rotate to a 45 degree there is enough friction that it barely creeps out of my hand.While the battery does add some bulk, they have take the apple approach and rounded out the edges enough that if you hold this case in your hand, it feels slimmer than an iPhone with a bumper case. I personally prefer the feel of this case (and the small additional weight) to that of the phone with a bumper on it. The initial reaction I get when other see it, and find out that it has a battery it in, is "There's a battery in there? It is really thin if it has a battery, how long does it extend your use time?"I have only had the case a few days at this point, but with my usage I am finding that if I press and hold the button to start charging the phone back up at 40% that I will get to 100%. I haven't stopped using the phone, yet, however, while it was charging. Generally I am still browsing the web or talking on the phone for about 15 - 20% of the time it is charging the phone. I also haven't paid too much attention to how long it takes to get the phone that far... but my best guess would be it is about 1 hour. I also haven't paid too close attention to the charging time of the case (I will generally deplete the case and then slip it off to charge it back up and keep using my phone with the incipio feather case). It feels like it takes a long time, but I haven't really timed it, rough guess would be 1.5 hours to charge the case itself.I have charged my case with my old HTC EVO charger and used the same cable to sync the phone with iTunes through the micro USB cable. So that is very convenient considering that most other electronics I own use the standard micro USB. The case doesn't appear to be as picky as Apple about which charge it will accept... for example, in my car I have a USB charger from my jabra headset that the phone wouldn't charge from itself using an apple cable. However, if I plug in the case with a micro USB into the same charger, the case will light up and start charging (the iPhone doesn't charge in this instance however). The jabra charger is pushing out 5V 750mAh. I purchased another charger which was for the iPhone 4S [...] which pushes 5V, 1 Amp and this will charge both the case and the phone (together or separate, meaning it will charge the iPhone 4S will the apple cable).Cannot comment on Protection as I haven't dropped the phone (with our without the case), and I hope I never do. It does feel sturdy enough, however, to take a hit, just not a drop that is face down (see "minor issues" below).Minor issues:- I have an iPhone 4S so the ringer silencer is very close the edge of the hole as this case is for the iPhone 4 and apple moved the ringer silencer on the 4S.- the Flash is not usable while using the case as the hole for the camera/flash is so deep the flash comes back into the camera sensor and causes the picture to look washed out.- The hole for the flash and camera acts like a lint scrapper and picks up a lot of lint from my pocket.- Hole for the volume buttons is a little deep and makes it difficult to access them.- speaker is covered by the micro USB, but they appear to have a slot to push the sound out of the front toward the user... I haven't noticed a huge degradation in audio quality/volume however, calls on speaker and music through the speaker are still audible and plenty loud for me.-Case doesn't protect the front of the phone at all, if placed face down on a table, the screen would be resting on the table.-Glossy packaging (similar to the plastic on the back of the iPhone 3G/3Gs) make me feel like the case will look scratched up after some time (so far so good though over 1 week of setting it on tables in meetings and in restaurants and plenty of pocket insertions and removals. None of that very harsh, however)Overall: Very slick looking case, especially for having a battery. Highly recommend at this point if you are looking for a case that will give you a power bump to get your another 60% + of extra batter power in a slim design.

    Rating: 5

    2011-11-28: The Incipio Offgrid caught my eye because of how thin it is... for $45 I think its a steal... retail at $70. This case is just wonderful, battery charges my phone from 10% to about 75% which is great for only $45. It has a sleek design which i like. I bought this for my verizon iPhone 4, the edges are very close by the ringer switch but it does not interfere at all. headphone jack is recessed a lot ,but doesn't bother me, my bose headphone fit the jack, and i bought a thin 3.5 M-M audio cable from scoshe, which does not fit btw, so i ordered an adapter.     2013-10-02: I've been using this case for three months. The outer cover is holding up well so far, however the plastic part that the phone snaps into has a few flaws. Firstly, it isn't exactly the perfect fit. From day one I could not fit the upper left corner of the phone so that it seats perfectly in the holder. A little bit of the upper left edge (bezel) is not secured as it should be. Second. the plastic slots near the two side phone buttons are very thin, and are easily broken when trying to remove the phone from the case. This has already happened to me. Thirdly, the top and bottom of the phone are not protected by any part of the case. If you happen to drop your phone on the top or bottom, it could be damaged or marred. The case looks good and all buttons, speakers, mics, sensors, cameras, USB and headphone ports are accessible. It also protects the screen very well as there is a stiff card (probably plastic) of some kind sewed into the front cover. It will certainly protect your phone from keys etc. in your pocket, but may not be as protective as some other covers out there.

    2012-05-03: This is a fine leather case (mine is very dark brown) for the Galaxy Note.The idiosyncrasy? When the clasp is on the right, and the case opened "naturally," like a book, the Note is upside down. I've only had it (and my new Note) a day, and am getting used to it. No biggie.The leather has a nice feel in the hand. While not bulky, it has enough padding to provide some possibility a Note inside dropped to the ground would survive. Be aware, though, that while the Note is remarkably lightweight for its size, gravity will do as gravity does.It is pocketable, well, if you have commodious pockets. Don't think it will work with those new stylish lycra tights . . .When "snapped" into the case all the Note's ports and controls are accessible.One surprise. When the front cover is folded back, there's a "slot" into which a finger nicely nestles, which greatly helps when "one-handing" the otherwise cumbersomely large Note.I have, and really love, the Case Crown nylon rip-stop bags I've used for my iPad and MacBook Air. Senyx, the seller from which I bought, has reliably sold me several bags through Amazon, some shipped direct, others fulfilled by Amazon.I can recommend this case for your Note.

    Rating: 5

The only bad thing I have to say about the Flex case is that it seems that the color is painted on a black tpu case, and the lighter colors (like this light blue case) gets dirty and when washed the black tends to come thru especially on the corners.     2013-11-22: The case fits tight. I was skeptical at first because of the material (normally when I get a case like this the sides aren't very tight and they sometimes protrude out from the phone making the case useless) but after getting it and using it for the past few days, its great. I have no problem with the dust and dirt issues. The only thing that bothers me is what everyone else is saying - the lock button and volume buttons are tight/hard to press. Once you press them, you get no feedback from touch (you don't get that clicking sound or feeling that you are even hitting the buttons) but they do work. The volume buttons are finally getting broken in so I can feel them being pressed. The lock button is getting more loose too. Just keep using it and it will loosen up. When you put it on, make sure you push the sides on good. There must be a lip on the case and it needs to be flush against the sides to ensure it is on PERFECTLY. Overall, great minimal case. Its not bulky at all and fits in the pocket easily. Tight fit and easy to take off and on. Cut outs are perfect. Given the material, I don't recommend taking the case off and on a lot - it may not be as tight as when it was first put on. Got the Sport Yellow for my iPhone 5S.

  • B001RXTDP2

    $B001RXTDP2

    2010-05-07: I'm not sure about other phones, but for the Sprint HTC Mogul PPC-680 the sound doesn't come through to the 3.5mm jack. There's a trick to do this, however. Just remove or bend pin #1 on the diagram below, which is the pin closest to the diagonal corner of the USB port. If you look closely at the USB port on your phone, you'll see that the other three corners are square. Note that remove the pin from this cheap adapter, not your precious phone.The way I removed the pin was by using a sewing needle to pry the pin out of its location. Then use a small flat screwdriver to push the pin all the way down inside the jack.I tried this on my Mogul with Windows Mobile 6.1, and it works great. Now I can listen to my music via the tape adapter on my car or via my headphone (both having 3.5mm jack). The charger can work at the same time as well without any distortion on the sound._______________|************||************||*1*2*3*4*5*6.|.\_____________|Source:[...]

    Rating: 4

    2009-08-31: i'm running a 3rd party ROM (cyanogenmod) which is cupcake plus some donut, on my HTC dream, and it works for me. i tried the 3.5mm port, and the USB headset port while charging and all is good. no headset switching software.IMO, this thing is too big to use as a simple 3.5mm <-> USB adapter while mobile. if you need that, buy one that is dedicated to that purpose. this one is good when you are stationary, and you want to charge / listen to headset at the same time.

    Rating: 5

    2009-10-04: This a solid OEM, straight-from-HTC adapter that works fantastic with my HTC Vogue (Verizon Touch). Very well made, allows for charging and listening to music via 3.5mm simultaneously. Works great in the car, and at home.

    Rating: 4

    2010-03-09: Just received my new best friend yesterday!I've recently been downloading alot of music to my phone and playing it throught my car stereo using an fm transmitter. What I wasn't able to do was keep my phone charged...since there is only one port on the G1. This device solved the problem!I plugged the headphone adapter chord that came with my G1 into the headphone port and my car charger into the charge/usb port of this device. It worked like a charm! I can now listen to pandora radio or the songs I have downloaded to my phone through my car stereo and not worry about draining my battery at all on those long trips. I also use it at work with my portable speakers.I was a little worried after reading some of the negative reviews with people having problems getting this to work and having to download programs, but I figured for the price it was worth a shot. Not sure if they're experiencing this with other phones but it works great on the G1. Glad I took a chance!Love It!

    2009-06-23: It's a pity. This worked fine until I got the 1.5 "cupcake" update to my G1 phone. Now it is not recognized by the phone, so it's useless.

    2009-09-08: It will charge with a car charger and work with a cd player that has an 3.5mm aux outlet on it at the same time.     2014-04-13: This is an older model phone. With that comes some practical issues involving the purchase and installation of apps and games. The user forums were invaluable in helping getting this resolved and getting back on track. Once passed that hiccup you will find most apps are somewhat glitchy.
