    2014-02-22: This OtterBox Commuter Series case is the best iPhone case I've ever owned. It provides me with sufficient protection for my iPhone without adding too much bulk.I had the OtterBox Defender Series case before this one, and while that case probably does offer a bit more protection, it adds a LOT of bulk. And, I also did not like the OtterBox Defender Series case's port covers. Specifically, the main port cover at the bottom of the case. It was always very difficult to get it to close properly, and I eventually just cut it off with a pair of scissors.Now, with that said, while I found this Commuter Series case to provide ample protection for me, IF you are someone who frequently drops their phone, you may still want to consider the Defender Series case, as again, it is clearly a much beefier case.For me, this OtterBox Commuter Series case is perfect. It is designed very well, it fits the iPhone 4/4S perfectly, and I do feel that it provides me with sufficient protection. I've owned quite a few different iPhone cases, and so far this case is my favorite.

I've had my black commuter case for a little over a year and its a lot softer than this one. I use the TechArmor Privacy Screen Protector and it didn't fit right with this combination. With the black silicon it worked fine. It could have just been the stiff silicon. Maybe after wearing it out a little it'll fit better. Still a great product.Oh and it did include original packaging and screen protector. My black commuter was from the Verizon store-VZ packaging and no screen protector. And more expensive.

    Rating: 5

    2013-06-29: So first off, this is not a terrible case. It has a nice form factor, appears very well made, and provides ample protection, including a small bumper which protrudes to protect the screen, which I consider essential and is missing from many other "slim" cases. (Admittedly I never dropped my phone in the case so I can't vouch for it being as protective as it appears.) Unfortunately I do have some quibbles which makes me unable to recommend this case for the $20 I paid for it.1) The case is actually two separate parts, a silicone inner section and a hard plastic shell. This is a somewhat awkward system and I wonder about it's purpose as it doesn't appear that you could use either part separately, so why make them as separate pieces. In any case, it makes putting your phone into the case MUCH more difficult. It took me probably ten minutes to get my phone lodged in there properly, and I was worried all the while that something was going to rip. If you dont change cases often this isn't a huge deal but it is bothersome.2) The hard plastic shell is oddly slippery. I know this doesn't seem too bad, but considering how often I'm holding my phone I could easily imagine it being a sizable annoyance.3) This is more of a recommendation, it looks terrible if you're using it with a white phone (If it's the black case.) I thought it might look good but it was actually very unattractive to have the black case with my white ipod. My personal opinion (although my girlfriend agreed.)

    Rating: 3

    2013-04-02: I would so buy a norther one. I like at how slim it is. The case is really slim and sleek.

    2014-03-23: The other 5 star reviews say it all - wonderful phone!Regarding the many reports of the wrong phone (AT&T; version) shipped:First of all the I9300 (international) version will work on AT&T; in the USA - no problem. That's what I'm on.If you get an AT&T; version however (not an I9300), send it back, esp if you are outside the USA! If the mistake is Amazon's I believe that they even refund the return shipping. I believe that the AT&T; version uses a different processor which may give higher performance on AT&T;'s own LTE networks (will still work on any GSM network anywhere), but if you are outside the USA I would return it and ask for what was ordered.Note that these phones originate from many countries (that's how they get the price down), so that you may get an instruction manual in Turkish or some other language that you don't speak. You may also get a European power plug (you just need a cheap adapter).Enjoy this wonderful phone!

    2011-03-12: I bought this case just for the fact that it was an Otterbox product. The inside pattern of this case must have rubbed this pattern into the material. The back of the phone has the same pattern on it, but I can replace the back cover. The sides are another matter. I ordered the Innocase Rugged product and am much more happy with that case. It was 5 times the cost of this simple Otterbox case, I should have just gotten it to begin with.

    2011-07-11: I have this on my EVO. I really like it. It protects the camera lens that sticks out the back from scratches. I've managed to fumble my phone twice and with this case on it it still has no scratches or internal damage. I did manage to get the case dirty with maple syrup and saw dust. I removed it from the phone and washed it in dish water. Dried it with a soft towel and allowed it to sit in the drainer until all the little crevices were dry. Then I put it back on my phone. It came with a screen protector which I didn't realize and I didn't use since I already had a screen protector on it. I really like this case and wish that they made one like it for the EVO Shift that the 4 others on my account have.

    2011-01-29: The Otterbox Impact Series case is a good case and offers great protection. I have dropped my phone on asphalt with the case from waist height and no damage at all. It makes the phone around .71 inches thick but thats a small price to pay for good protection. The material is very high quality. It does become an issue trying to take my phone out of my jeans pocket and it does collect lint at first. The main issue I'm having is that it has stretched a little over time and the phone slides inside the case a little but not enough for it to come off at all.The case protects the camera lens and actually makes it easier to use the power and volume rocker buttons. The kickstand works just fine and access to the headphone jack, hdmi and power are good. Overall this case has amazing quality and is what to expect from Otterbox. In general any type of soft case will stretch a little and might collect lint. So if you don't mind that and the thickness of the case, the Otterbox Impact series case is a good protective case.

    $B003WUX75A

    2011-07-29: After a series of poor-quality cases purchased at the Verizon store, I picked this unit up.I wanted something that would protect the phone from a slight fall, but not be so thick as to keep it from being used with a belt pouch. This is the case....it's high quality, nicely covered with a leather-like substance, and provides a full hard plastic cover for the vulnerable sides and back of the phone.I liked it so much that when I wore out the first one (I pull the phone in and out of the pouch a lot), I purchased two more....one to use, another as a spare.Good product!

    Rating: 5

    2011-05-29: This case if purely for fashion and not for practicality. Don't expect this case to stay on after you dropped your phone. I've had two of these and neither one of them has managed to protect my phone from any damage. The leather case is a nice little fashion accessory and the stand, which is almost impossible to open for the first time, is perfect for watching videos on those lazy days when you just don't feel like holding your phone. Overall this was what I wanted, but wouldn't mind a case that doesn't snap apart every drop.

    Rating: 4

    2010-08-13: The "leather" coating feels like nothing more than hard plastic. And, the kickstand is a bear to get out (I have to use an ink pen or something similar to pop it out -- it's so difficult to do that you're liable to break a nail). Having said all that, it's a solid, hard plastic case with a leather look. Somewhat slippery to hold though. And, once you get the kickstand actually out, it's pretty cool.Update: Now that I've had the case on my Droid X for a bit, here are a couple more observations: It actually begins to have more of a slight "leather feel" the longer I've used it. The kickstand is worthless when charging, as it is on the same side as the mini USB port, rendering it unusable for that purpose. Looks good on the X, but beginning to wonder now how much I'll actually use the kickstand.

    Rating: 3

    2010-08-27: The Amzer Limited Edition Elite Leather Snap On Hard Case is an exact clone of the case Verizon sells at its stores for $25. I've bought a couple of different style cases for my Droid X, and so far this one is the one I like most. It fits very well, even with the BH6X extended battery. It's not bulky, and weighs little. It's far from perfect though. The case is actually a plastic shell, with a thin leather skin glued onto it. I have my doubts that it will hold up for a long period of time. The kickstand while useful, is next to impossible to open without excessive force. It also rattles when closed, which annoys me. Phone protection is probably minimal too. For now it's my case of choice, but I'll keep looking for something better.Edit: I have to change my opinion on the protection the case provides. Yesterday, I accidentally dropped my phone on a concrete sidewalk. The phone hit on its top corner. Although there's a good sized gash in the case, the phone survived without a scratch. I'm pretty impressed now.

    Rating: 4

    2011-08-21: This is a good protective case for the droid x. Works great love the kick stand, but wish it was on the other side of the phone thats why it only gets 4 stars.

    2010-09-10: I bought one of these at the Verizon store and used it for a month. I wanted to switch to a case with a holster.     2010-09-17: The cover fits well and looks great to me. Mine looks and feels like leather.     2011-06-06: I'm surprised anyone would not give this 5 stars. I actually paid twenty dollars for this a few months ago. The texture is like hard leather- like a shoe- but textured. I have dropped my phone several times on concrete and no scratches on my phone. The case did snap off once, but only after being dropped. The only negative thing I can find about this is that it is difficult to remove if you need to pull the battery. However, that's my phone's fault. There should be no reason for me to pull the battery, but it freezes occasionally, and therefore need to pull the battery. I don't have a problem pulling out the kickstand. It is firm but I'm able to pop it out with fake nails as well as my soft real nails. The case looks nice, they kickstand is extremely useful when watching a youtube video or playing chess :)Update: After a couple of months and another few drops, one of the side tabs broke. It won't snap shut anymore. I went back to my old case that was a bejeweled case that attracted lint like crazy, and am now on the search for another. Yet here I am...eyeing this case again...the only one with a slim kickstand. The other commentor was right when he said the kickstand shouldve been on the other side; you can't charge the phone and use the kickstand simultaneously. Other than that, I'm thinking of buying it again. It protected my phone from several drops, and therefore worth it.

They tend to feel slimy and the phone will still slip out of my hand when my hand gets a little sweaty. I highly recommend it!

    $B0067WEX1M

    2012-08-28: I have been using the Galaxy Note for about 4 months now and it is without question one of the best phones I have ever owned. That being said, I will not type anymore words extolling its greatness as there are many positive reviews already written that cover anything I could say.I will take this time to write about two glaring omissions that would have made this the creme de la creme of Android phones.1 - The speaker phone is abysmalYou would think with phone this big they would have the space to put a good speaker or god forbid even stereo speakers in this bad boy, but no. The speaker is barely audible in the car unless you place it right next to your ear, music playback is quite lame, podcasts are just tolerable.2 - No LED indicator lightWhy oh why can I not look across the room and see an indication of whether I have missed a call or received a text message, why in 2012 do they make a 700.00 phone without a simple LED alert light, this in my opinion is an inexcusable omission.So, other than those two issues it is a great phone. I just wanted to warn potential buyers so they know up front about these issues.

    2012-03-09: Bought this earlier this week from BB after trading in my Iphone 4. Also got a 50 dollar gift card for buying it from them so plus 2. The speed of the device hands down faster than the Iphone 4. Its icredibly thin and lite for its sheer size. Completely dwarfs my Iphone with screen size alone. Bought a gal case at the local AT&T store and paid way too much but needed protection other than from just insurance. I get about 13-15 hours on a charge with regular use, without wifi on, bluetooth or gps that is. Brightness all the way up. The videos look like 1080p like watching my 120hz led samsung tvs at home Im not kidding. Accepts MP4 format for videos. Watching movies on it I'm in awe. And 1080p you tube videos have to be seen to be believed. Email easy to set up once you get past Gmail account which you need to access the android market. Happy I got the white after years with a black iphone. I am able most of the time to use it one handed but not that easy takes practive I have normal male hands not huge. Overall so far the best phone Ive had. I had the Dell Streak when it released in 2010 but it was too glitchy and slow this blows that away.

    Rating: 5

    2012-03-22: REVISED/UPDATE--May 7, 2013: For over one year, I have owned this phone with no problems and it still looks and performs like new! AND GREAT NEWS: On May 6, 2013, I checked and Jelly Bean OTA (Over the Air directly on the phone) is HERE NOW! And today, I installed 4.1.2 Jelly Bean and LOVE IT on the GNote, feels like I just bought a new phone! Just for you to know: Samsung began rolling out OTA in late March 2013 for the Note N7000 so it takes a while for every country to receive this. So here is is all 511 GB of it! To get the update go to Settings, About Device and Software Update (you need to be in WiFi or Data and have 75% battery). The update is HUGE because it is Jelly Bean (no more Ice Cream Sandwich)! Now more about this great phone: I thought very long and hard before I bought this device in late February, 2012 and it came SEALED in the original box - totally new and unopened! This review is for the WHITE INTERNATIONAL UNLOCKED version of this device. I bought it from Amazon but chose to do the review under the dark blue device because it has more reviews and will be read more often.***Since over one year has past since I purchased the device (Feb 16, 2012), so I am more confident about this device as it works wonderfully in all areas! The reason I mention that is ALL INTERNATIONAL phones DO NOT have a US warranty and I took a HUGE chance spending $700 (at the time of purchase, it is now about $620) for this device! However, I have owed smartphones and computers for many years and have found that if they fail, 95% of the time they fail WITHIN THE FIRST 30 DAYS! In fact all of my smartphones have "shown" me in the first 30 days by "acting up" whether they would last or not. I have NEVER (so far) had any problems with this device. It is superb. Below are PROS and CONS.PROS:1) Huge 5.3" screen that is vivid, clear and easy to read. **The size is NOT TOO BIG for me and I am just 5'3" with small hands and the phone is light and easy to carry around. I also bought a combo pink case/cover for $10 on eBay that is slimline and protects the phone in style!2) Great music player with good sound with headset or speaker.3) FM radio included (AT&T; version does not have FM radio). So you DO NOT have to be on WiFi or Data to listen to the built in FM Radio App!4) Fast processor.5) Data has been 3g+ to 4g for data and it is lightening fast, fast, fast! (Mostly I use WiFi, but sometimes data and again, it is very fast). I have AT&T; data that I buy each month as I have the gophone (pre-paid plan) and I buy the smallest data they have as I use WiFi 95% of the time. However, I use my Tab2 7.0 3g for my data now as it has a larger screen.6) WiFi easy to connect and works perfectly with long range ability!7) Good stock browser, however, I downloaded Dolphin HD Browser and I can get "desktop" pages (not mobile pages) and also tabs, and so so many features. Opera is OK, but Dolphin HD blows all the other browsers away!8) Battery life - Decent - Since I am on WiFi or Data 100% of the time when I use this device so the battery lasts me about 5 hours before I have to recharge. Now when I turn the WiFi on and off to conserve battery, I get about 10 hours or more! Also I have backlight on 90%!9) I chose White color, very regal looking - so this is a pro for me!10) Size: Perfect combo mini tablet with 5.3" screen and great phone, don't need to lug around my 10" tablet anymore! And I do not think this device is too big to use as a phone and have no problem putting it up to me ear to make a call. This phone is lightweight and easy to hold. I bought a pink snap combo faux leather cover/case on eBay from US seller for just $10 and it is an all in one case and cover so this device is easy to carry and it is protected at all times.11) Camera and Video Camera - This takes better pictures than my regular camera and I move the pictures to my 32 gig SD card. And video is wonderful for a quick video! Mostly I take pictures when I am out and about, so no need to have to take my old camera as this device is: CAMERA, MINI TABLET, MUSIC PLAYER, FM RADIO ALL IN ONE DEVICE!!!!!CONS:1) This is an INTERNATIONAL PHONE WITH NO US WARRANTY. However, in the box there was a 24 month warranty with a Samsung UK address and phone number for the UK warranty center. This is the only concern I have. However, in my experience, most devices "act up" or "fail" within the first 30 days, (about 90% of the time), I am not worried, as I have had the phone well over 30 days and it is working perfectly and I am very pleased with my purchase of this device. So for this ONE reason, I deducted 1/2 of a star, hence 4.5 stars instead of the 5 stars that I would have given to this device.2) APN SETTINGS for Internet Data and MMS messages must be manually inputted (all international phones require this). WiFi and text messaging works right out of the box, however, APN settings are needed for Data and MMS messaging.If anyone needs the APN settings for AT&T; or T-Mobile, please comment and ask and I will answer and give you the APN settings. Also, I will answer any questions as I am a techie type of person. Thank you for reading my review.Please feel free to join our discussion should you have any questions or comments regarding the Galaxy Note. Since I am a techie person, I will be glad to answer questions.Thank you for reading this updated review and I hope that it has been of assistance to you.

    Rating: 5

    2012-06-06: I got a Note in white. Took it to T-Mobile only to find out that the SIM card slot had a "leg" missing. Back it went.Reordered it, and now it freezes, to unfreeze it I take the battery out. it takes a long time time to "wake up", battery feels really warm, almost hot, have to wait for a long time for the system to finish scanning the media card, so if I am in a hurry to make a phone call, well, no luck there. I like the phone a lot, but it is more trouble than is worth (to me). So I am afraid this unit will go back too.

    Rating: 2

    2013-01-06: If you are already here, I'm assuming you are seriously considering getting this phone.1) You will not use the stylus as much as you think.2) You will love this phone.I have had this phone almost a year. I probably use the stylus once every 2 weeks to write down a quick memo.I'm a girl so I generally keep my phone in my purse or bookbag. Girl's jeans generally aren't big enough for my phone, and my few that are only about 1/2 to 2/3rds of the phone fit in the pocket. It can fit into guys jeans and cargo pants really well with room to spare generally. You can sorta tell that it is in there though.I don't consider the size a disadvantage, since I love how big the screen it.I got a case that covers the front and flips over to the back (like a book). I really like it because I feel safe putting it in my purse or bookbag, without scratching it's beautiful screen. Make sure not to get a case with a magnet on it. In simple terms, the pen works though a magnet in the tip of the pen interacting with your screen, and I've heard stories of a magnet in the case messing with the phone and creating permanent dead spots that can't be written on anymore with the pen.Also, when looking for cases, if it is a case that replaces the back of your phone, make sure to check if it is for the N7000 and not the AT&T; one. They don't have the same spots that snap together, and you will be very sad.If you have any questions, I'll try my best to answer. :)

    Rating: 5

    2012-07-30: This is just the BEST wireless handset out there.The screen is big and gorgeous. Bright and vivid color. 5.3" of pure visual honey.The stylus is handy.It is speedy and smooth. Apps launch fast and moving between screens is fluid.The 2500 mAh battery is high capacity and lasts all day.Once you have this "phablet" phone there is no going back to smaller screens.Audio quality is quite good through the built-in speakers and the earpiece.Highly recommended !

    Rating: 5

    2012-02-28: 1. Poor battery life! I read the specs before purchasing and it says that it lasts much longer than the Samsung Infuse, my previous phone, but NOT even close! For example, I'd charge the battery on Samsung NOTE to full capacity until around noon or so and then by 6 or 7pm the battery indicator is already in the red! This is barely surfing or talking. I never had a problem like this with my Infuse or my Samsung S2, my current phone.2. You can't create Ymail on the default android email account!! I didn't have this problem with Infuse or my current S2! I had to have 3 different email apps with the NOTE to see all my emails. I have over 10 different email accounts such as Yahoo, Rocketmail, Ymail and Gmails. So this is really inconvenient compared to my former phone Infuse!3. You can't turn off the loud clicking/shutter sound when taking pictures or Video recording! Again, there's no such problems with the Samsung Infuse or S2?? I like to have some privacy when taking pictures of the black board or the overhead screen projection during my class room lecture or meetings. This is really ridiculous!In summary, if you pay over $700 for a phone then it shouldn't have the problems I mentioned. Why is it that the less expensive phone can do more or give you more? It's illogical! I returned/sold the NOTE after having it for 5 days. I hated the thought of paying so much for a phone and getting less than my previous Samsung Infuse which I sold for only $300. I now own Samsung S2 and love it! Also, I can create all email accounts onto just one app. (NOTE: Samsung S2 AT&T; version allows Ymail but not the Samsung S2 i9100 International version) The only good thing about the NOTE is that the screen size is perfect for me. But otherwise, I wouldn't recommend the NOTE because of its price. It should be worth no more than $550 at this time for the flaws I mentioned.

    Rating: 2

    2012-11-25: I love this phone. It has all the features I want and a large screen to easily view all pages. I was carrying two devices (phone and tablet) and now only have to carry one to solve all my needs.

    Rating: 5

    2012-04-13: I came thisclose to buying a refurbed iPhone 4s and at the last minute just couldn't press click on the sale. What held me back? Really wanted an Android OS without the limits on it like the Kindle Fire. While the IOS5 is no doubt awesome, just didn't want to be limited by Steve Jobs' view of the world. (Flash, please.) But I was initially beaten down by the way-too-many Android phone options, with their respective pros & cons. IPhone 4s was just an easy way out. UNTIL....I saw the white Samsung Galaxy Note. No more need for a heavy tablet to drag around on the road with me. Can still use the Straight Talk Unlimited Plan, courtesy of the sim card from my Nokia e71. Gorilla glass, so no PITA screen saver needed. Blazing fast data connections (thanks to another customer's inclusion of the best APN settings for the Note in his Amazon review). A screen more brilliant than any device I have ever owned. The most perfect size...it fits comfortably in my hand even with a leather case on it.[Zenus] Masstige Ostrich Diary Case Cover for Galaxy Note (I9220/N7000) - Royal NavyLightweight. The Android Gingerbread OS is awesome & can't wait for the ICS update. And did I mention the SIZE? The iPhone 4s I almost bought fits completely inside the glass screen of the Note. I would have been miserable trying to read that 3.5" screen and constantly zooming in & out. No zooming needed with my Note.About the Amazon sale: next day delivery with Prime. Fulfilled by Amazon but the seller changed between the time I placed the order and when it was shipped. But the phone arrived in a sealed original box with everything intact. Had to change the language from Spanish to English since it's an unlocked international version. No warranty but I am OK with that. If anything goes wrong, it happens in the first 30 days usually with tech items.Negatives: none. You have to figure out settings etc when dealing with an unlocked phone but Google is your friend. The battery does not last a full day for me but I am figuring out how to find and turn off auto updates etc that suck battery power. But I do plan to buy an extra batteryHyperion Samsung Galaxy Note 2 x Battery + Charger (Compatible with At&t; Samsung Galaxy Note, and all international Galaxy Note models)and keep it handy. The tech experts on You Tube claim they have no problem with battery life but they are smarter than I am in figuring out how to reduce battery drain thru apps & widgets.Android OS: I hate the live wallpaper and can't figure out how to get rid of the stock wallpaper screens I do not want. Google has not been my friend. I've read that the international Notes will receive the ICS update before the AT&T; Notes. Gingerbread runs like silk for now.I am so glad something stopped me from sealing the deal on an iPhone 4S. The Note exceeds all my expectations in features I anticipated and those I didn't even know existed.Get the white if like me you just don't "see" black gadgets anymore, like in the handbag or on the desk, and have to call your black phone to find it. The white is elegant and cool.

    2012-08-10: this is just great! the size is perfecto for me! it fits on my jeans... you will love the size of this screen, procesor, memory, storage everything is great... only thing i would improve is battery life but this is common to all smartphone this has better battery life than galaxy s2 because it has a bigger battery! it is running ICS and im waiting for jelly bean!

    Rating: 5

    2013-12-04: This is a retractable USB-micro cable. I use these things all the time for charging my smartphone, e-reader, tablet, and external battery packs. So far I haven't found a device that doesn't work with this cable, and it also works fine for transferring data. I've used it on both 1A and 2A outlets and it seems to work just like any other cable.The neat thing about this one is it retracts. At full length it's a bit less than a yard long, which is plenty for me. A standard cable of this length is a pain to manage- gets tangled and stuck way too easily. These ones wind up when not in use and are adjustable to any length between, making them a lot easier to handle. When retracted they easily fit in a pocket.Perhaps best of all, the things are dirt cheap- these are cheaper than most non-retracting USB-micro cables I've seen. I've been a bit rough with the mechanism on occasion and they seem reasonably durable as well. They're my cable of choice for travel use.So far I've used it with the following devices, with no issues:Kindle PaperwhiteKindle Fire HD 7"Samsung Galaxy S3HTC EVO 3DAssorted external battery packs (Pyle, Anker, Gorilla)I've used these to charge from outlets, 12V car cig lighter adapters, and external battery packs. Works fine.

    2013-12-17: These cases are nicely designed and having 10 to select for a color choice is fun. But we ended up tossing them away because they were incompatible with our choice of screen protector. The case kept lifting the edge of the protector. Part of the problem may be due to our choice of screen protector. But part is due to the fact that these cases are so soft that they move around a bit as you hold them and squeeze the sides to have a good grip on the phone. That movement is what was causing the case to lift the edge of our screen protector.We use ArmorSuit screen protectors. They really fit the Samsung Galaxy S3 perfectly, even though the screen has tapered edges. But the ArmorSuit material is soft and can be lifted if a case wraps around the front and is in contact with the protector as it is in our case.We have three S3 phones and all of us experienced the same problem using these cases. Luckily we were able to re-stick the edges of the protector that these cases tried to pull up.We have all moved on to other cases that don't wrap around the front of the screen. In our case none of us have a history of dropping our phones so we don't need cases for damage. We just want a case that provides a better grip as the S3 is slippery.I'll give the case 3 stars because they aren't bad. But I'll take off stars because they don't work with all screen protectors as they wrap around the top edge and contact the screen protector and they move which can interfere with the screen protector. Pretty cheap though. We wish they would have worked for us.

    Rating: 5

    2013-04-30: How do they do it? I got 10 nice quality cases in a great pallet of colors for $15 which even qualified for "Prime" shipping. This order was great as 5 members of my family have the Samsung Galaxy S3. My wife and I and mother-in-law just started a new cell phone plan and got these cases within the week. We chose our colors (orange and purple), my son (black) mother in law (blue) and daughter in law (pink). As a backup, I also chose the bright green and my wife chose the deep red.The case is very good quality. It is NOT flimsy, soft silicone. It fits very snug and stays on. Some have said it's too tight but that's subjective, I had no problem getting it on. It's a blend of about 75% 'hard' plastic and 25% soft silicone thrown in. The slight soft texture gives it just enough grip/traction so it doesn't slip off slightly angled surfaces like car dashboards. ALL the holes (in the cases I've taken) line up perfectly. There was a tiny bit of over-mold flashing in the two smallest holes (which doesn't hamper anything) but it's nothing a sharp scalpel (if you have one) didn't take care of.With the Galaxy S3 being so popular and on sale at a lot of places (due to the release of the S4), getting 10 cases is nice for families. I'll bet you' may even have a friend who could use a new case.Thank you "The Friendly Swede" and Amazon!!

    Rating: 5

    2012-09-12: These fit perfectly, look and feel nice, and are of sturdy construction, but the hole where the charger plugs in isn't quite big enough for the OEM S3 charger. You have to pop the bottom half of the cover off to get the charger to go all the way in.There is also a bit of flashing around the edge that can confuse you when you are feeling for button locations. I trimmed it off with an exacto.I also have the flip cover, and these actually fit onto the device with the flip cover. The caveat is that you can't really feel the volume rocker when you have the flip cover open, but since they weren't made for this, I can't exactly dock points. I am considering attempting to modify one of the pink ones (not a big fan of pink) to see if I can solve this, and if it works, I may modify the rest too. Perhaps someone can come up with a silicone cover designed to work with the flip cover.The colors are striking against the white galaxy S3.If they would fix the charger issue, this would be a great buy, and would get a five star rating.

    2013-04-10: I purchased this phone since it was the lowest prepaid T-Mobile phone I could find. I needed to port my phone number from my VoIP provider to Google Voice, but Google Voice can only port in mobile phone numbers. So I ported my number for free from my VoIP provider to this phone, and then to Google Voice for a twenty dollar fee. I barely used this phone, but for the extremely low price it seemed like a decent phone if you need to keep things simple and inexpensive. The buttons were nice and large and the screen was fairly easy to read. The menu navigation was a little weird until you got the hang of it. It is so amazing how low the price is for this phone, especially since there is no contract. If you are looking for a very inexpensive prepaid phone, this seems like a great choice.

    Rating: 4

    2014-04-25: After my sgs2 started acting up I knew I had to get a another phone to keep the lines open. But I didn't feel like getting another android phone or apple, especially with news of the upcoming Nexus and iPhone 6 later this year. So I decided to tough it out and get a basic flip phone. Just 8 years ago touch screen smart phones were barely coming in and people were crazy about getting latest and greatest bar, flip or slider :) I want to gain an appreciation of wireless phone technology by removing the clutter of apps, finicky OS's, short battery life, featureless slabs of gorilla glass and sky high prices.I chose this phone for its utter simplicity and long battery life. It's running smoothly for me no hiccups at all. With my SGSII I had gotten into the habit of charging it every night. But with this phone Alcatel 665 I haven't had to charge for three days before one of the bars disappeared. Reception with tmobile in my area was better than the galaxy and at times was more accurate at reading service availability.Operating the phone Is pretty basic and you'd be able to figure stuff out pretty easily. Just make sure you go through all the submenus, cuz they hold extra tidbits of information -sometimes important ones. Comes with one battery, micro USB charger, instructions and a SIM card. If you're gonna be handing this off to elderly folks you might want to configure some of the more complex stuff yourself first, like: sim card or handset lock so you have a copy of the codes, style of ringing, alarms, profiles, etc.

All the ring tones on this phone are tunes and he can't hear them. I'm sure I can find and download a phone ring ringtone for him somewhere! He has trouble hearing high pitch. All the ring tones are high pitch. Don't think I can change that.Also, he can't read any of the writing on the front without a magnifying glass.     2012-10-21: The Galaxy S3 has proven to be a fragile phone without a case, go look at all the youtube videos and google search Galaxy S3 fragile and you will find tons of hits on how this phone will shatter without a case. Since I spent so much money on this phone I didn't want to go with a slim TPU case because they don't offer adequate drop protection but I didn't want an otterbox case either because those things are too big. This case was just in the medium and it fit just right. It offers medium protection without the bulk, it's easy to slip in and out of pockets. The majority of the back is glossy so the grip is solid unlike matte covers. The only con is the crappy screen protector it comes with and the back glossy part is prone to scratches as well as the front lip isn't really that thick. Overall this has been a great case but I'm sticking with the UAG Urban Armor for better lip protection.

    2012-09-19: Been researching for a medium duty case for over a week now and find the Faxion to be the best compromise in decent protection while adding a very minimal amount of bulk. I generally have the Rock Quicksand case (excellent case by the way) on my S3 most of the time, but will switch over to the Faxion when I know I'll need a little more drop protection.Doesn't add very much bulk at all, but definitely provides some decent drop protection. I always put it on when I know my kids are going to be playing with my phone. Case has nice styling, but I suppose that's going to vary for everyone. The white and grey looks great on my white S3 and doesn't look out of place in an office environment. Adds a little bit of weight but it feels very good in the hand.Looked at the Incipio Silicrylic also but didn't want the 2 piece case and wasn't a fan of silicone. Also looked into the Speck Candyshell, but read a few reviews about the charger port area cracking. Also saw that the Faxion was slightly thinner than the Candyshell and I was looking for a secondary protective case that added the least amount of bulk. So far, very happy with this one. The back gets a little scratched up, but with the white, it's not very noticeable.

    Rating: 5

  • B003NQ2REK

    $B003NQ2REK

    2014-03-24: Our neighbor vacationed in his 5th wheel in Oregon all last summer and he was not able to get a signal from the RV space he was in. He bought one of these and said he could get phone, text and internet on his AT&T; phone.Since we live in the hinter lands of Arizona and have AT&T; cell and since we usually get between 1 and 3 bars out of the 5 possible here at home we thought we would try one. It took my husband's phone from 1 bar on the scale to 4~! We are also going to spend the summer in our motor home this summer and are very excited to be able to stay in :contact" with the world.

    Rating: 5

    2013-11-25: If you live / work in a concrete an and brick building like I do, then this is a great product. I went from being unable to send / receive calls except sporadically to full bars most of the time. I have a Samsung III with AT&T.; I get a good 4G LTE signal most of the time. I've noticed some of my apps don't respond perfectly but that's minor compared to being able to text and call.Don't get the amplifier that runs through your internet and involves a monthly charge until you try this booster. I highly recommend this product and wish I had known about it earlier.

    Rating: 5

    2014-03-13: We own a cabin in Strawberry Arizona. Verizon signal is available, but AT&T (my carrier) has no signal at the cabin. With this amplifier and a (car)roof-mount ground plane antenna, I was able to maintain a phone call all the way to the cabin. Next step will be to install a higher gain antenna on the roof of the cabin. Nearer to my home in northern Utah, I was getting -84 db in a canyon where ordinarily I would have seen no signal at all. Very impressed.

    Rating: 5

    2013-08-01: I would have given this 5 stars if the "holder" it self was a little more flexible in terms of adjustments for various size phones. I have a Galaxy Note and while I can make it fit with the cover on, it is very tight. Otherwise, very pleased get a great signal where I barely got any signal before.

    Rating: 4

    2013-03-14: We have a concrete/steel office, and near the back of the building, the signal is EXTREMELY weak. My Note II displays -107dBm 35asu and wasn't able to pick up a carrier signal half the time.With this booster plus the larger magnetic antenna (301125), my Note II is registering -85dBm 49asu with a full 4G LTE signal -- speed tests @ 8879/2196kbit, 4 bars.Pretty slick!

    Rating: 5

    2013-09-07: Definitely boosts my signal with my Samsung Galaxy S4 on ATT with LTE. The antenna I bought was: Wilson Electronics Dual Band - 800-1900 MHz Magnet Mount Antenna with SMA Male Connector and 10-Foot RG174 Coax Cable . Note: this product comes with a 4 inch antenna, but I wanted the full-experience 12 incher (that's what she said?). EDIT: I also have used this with a "CA24M" 24" antenna (requires a male FME to male SMA adapter). Amazon doesn't sell this, but Google it and you'll find the place that sells it (CellAntenna Corp.). In the mail I have the 40" antenna "CA40M" just to see what a ridiculously-long antenna can do.I installed the antenna on my trunk and I see an increase in dBm (signal strength) as well as download speeds (24Mbps -> 31Mbps). I haven't had a chance to test it's "max-range" in the middle of the desert yet, but what I see from in-my-garage testing shows promise.The product also fits my S4 well. It comes with 3 sets of interchangeable "wings" of different widths. I ended up using the medium size set.

    Rating: 5

I can't comprehend why anyone would spend hundreds of dollars on an iPhone and then put it in a cheap case. I want my investment protected.We are an iPhone family and theLifeproof case provides peace of mind.Take the time to read the instructions and follow the instructions to the letter. If the sound is muffled then you have too much air inside the case. Open the port door and firmly press all the way down the screen protector; closing the port door before releasing pressure.

If the seal breaks or you have a problem with it leaking if it is registered they will get replacement parts to you free of charge.

There are a few paces where the stitching is messed up a bit. It looks bad but the case is not falling apart yet.The other major issue is that the case opens backwards! Not only does this feel weird when trying to use the phone it also makes most of your apps upside down when you try to use the case in stand mode.Huge oversight in my book.But the case does what I purchased it for.     2012-12-28: This is very similar to a tablet case. The material is faux leather. It is functional. It is not wider than a typical TPU case. I would also recommend a magnetic latch which could be used to keep the cover closed as well as open. However, for the price, this item is most reasonable.

    Rating: 4

    2012-12-29: The fit and finish are really great on this case. The leather has a very plush feel to it. Very nice fit and doesn't add a lot of extra bulk. There should have been a cut-out made for this. It's not that it's inaccessible because it is.
